We walked from here to the Pike Place Market, the Seattle Public Library, shopping, the waterfront for a boat tour and to the Safeco baseball stadium to watch the Mariners. I was travelling with my 15 year old son and my sister. The hotel put us in a spacious room with two double beds and a pull-out couch. We all really liked the room decor. It was really funky in an upscale way. We signed up for the hotel's loyalty program and we were given a $10 coupon for free snacks from the mini-bar. My sister and I took advantage of the free wine (and beer) tasting every afternoon (5pm) in the lobby. We had some nice chats with the other guests at this time. We usually headed down to the lobby in the morning for free starbuck's coffee and tea. We ate a really nice breakfast in the hotel restaurant and I would recommend it highly. Two mornings we walked down closer to the Pike Place Market and ate breakfast at higher rated restaurants (from tripadvisor) but our most enjoyable breakfast was the one at the hotel. So I rated this hotel quite high because of the friendly and helpful staff, room decor, location and some of the freebies we received. The only negatives were that the work out room is quite small and really only appropriate for cardio. There were some free weights but no bench. The only other negative is the high cost of parking at this hotel( $36/night). We had driven to Seattle from Vancouver BC so we needed to park our car. We only used the car once during our 3 day stay so it was quite expensive to have it with us. In the future when I stay at this hotel I would investigate public parking in the area as other reviewers have mentioned better parking prices in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sue P
Reviews.Content: The Alexis blends in perfectly with the area and is in a great location. We had a car but never used it the entire weekend since everything we wanted to see was within walking distance. I've stayed here a few times for business and pleasure and I find the staff professional, courteous and intent on making your visit a great experience. Be sure to have a cocktail or two in the Library Bar. Staff were diligent in tending to drink orders without being solicitous. The lunch and dinner menu selections are varied and prepared well. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable with nice beds and several seating options. I found the valet parking to be high at $36 per day but we parked in a covered public parking structure one block down from the hotel that cost $12 per 24 hours. Still, parking in this city is not cheap and with valet you certainly pay for that convenience. This is a hotel I will continue to visit when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: karsmith
Reviews.Content: We had decided to stay somewhere a little cheaper in Seattle and in checking back at one point, found that through Hotels.com, they had a rate that was LESS than where we were staying so we switched! We had a basic Queen room, but it was quite large and very interesting in architecture. It was quiet (thankfully), and overlooked a little courtyard (it was on the 4th floor). The staff were great - the concierge had sent the information I had requested to a wrong email address and I didn't get it - he though made up for it with a bottle of wine and some fruit in our room. Very nice touch! It was nice to run down to get coffee complimentary in the morning and enjoy it in our room. We walked nearly everywhere as the location was terrific. Being lovers of single malt scotch we also enjoyed the very extensive list of same in the Library Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamela H
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting a great deal on Orbitz and could afford to stay a few days at the Alexis Hotel. We got a great corner room that was two walls of windows on the 4th floor. It was quiet, comfy, and romantically cozy. The a/c was a bit loud, but it wasn't so loud that it bothered me. The bathrooms were stocked with amazing toiletries. If you forgot something, they had nearly everything available to you with a phone call - including a hair straightener! My favorite part is the complimentary wine hour with local reds & whites. The staff was super helpful 24/7 and I couldn't have been more relaxed. Highly recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay where we were warmly welcomed!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_light57
Reviews.Content: Everything about the stay at the Alexis was perfection! While celebrating my 60th birthday in the PNW, my wife and I experienced a delightful stay in Seattle at the Alexis. The visit began with a warm, welcoming and efficient check-in and the excellence continued through out the stay. The concierge and crew made us feel special at every turn! The room was spacious, lovely, clean, comfy, and to top it off, we had great views... view of the harbor from the room and could see Mt. Ranier from the beautiful bathroom. In agreement with many other reviewers, this hotel has a great location enabling you to walk to many nearby restaurants, shops and areas of interest. The one overwhelming stand-out was their fantastic staff. They genuinely let you know they care! A rarity these days.If you are going to Seatlle, don't hesitate to stay at this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a relaxing time away”
Reviews.Author: iluvmyshihtzu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the Alexis Hotel. We have stayed at all three Kimpton properties in the Seattle area including the Alexis a number of times. The Alexis has always done us with a hospitable and relaxing experience. We visited on Friday October 7th on a last minute decision a few days prior. As always, the front desk staff are so warm and welcoming. Upon checking in. in casual conversation we said we were there to relax and my husband had just passed a big certification exam for his PMP (project management professional certification). He hadn't studied so hard since highschool! :-) When we came back from dinner and listening to live music on the town we opened our door and there was a really nice note congratulating my husband for being so studious and a plate of fresh fruit and a nice bottle of wine. These attention to details make Kimpton brand why we like to stay there especially the comfort and warmth of the Alexis Hotel. The beds are extremely comfortable and we love the down comforters. The evening wine hour is a nice touch. We always look forward to the yummy breakfast in the Library bistro! Thanks again Alexis for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter16
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel based on the great reviews and they were right. The location is perfect for sightseeing. We were able to walk to Pike Place Market, SAM (Seattle Art Museum), the waterfront, the Seattle underground and the Space Needle. The room was nice and spacious and the decor was great. The bed was super comfy and the bathroom was also very nice. The hotel was very clean and there was a nice attention to detail. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Seattle and wanting to walk to all of the tourist attractions. The only issue I had was with the costs for parking ($87 for two nights). I realize that parking in downtown is pricey but felt this was just too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Great spot to recuperate”
Reviews.Author: Tooheyspete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2011 for a few days with my wife and baby. We were upgraded to a suite which was fantastic - given we had a baby it meant we could put her to bed and remain up to relax. We all got ill on the day we arrived not the result of the hotel, and the room was big enough for us not to get cabin fever. It was a bit light on in terms of the restaurant, though everything else was fine. Would recommend for location & nice rooms - older style decor,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: nanciface
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis the night before leaving on a cruise from Seattle to Alaska. We arrived mid-day to find our room ready, check-in was quick and efficient. Our room was great: a four poster king bed facing a flat screen television and then a sitting room next to the bed with a wood- burning fireplace, sofa, chair and very large flat screen tv! The bathroom was also very nice, with high-end toiletries and cute robes. We would have been happy to have been able to stay longer but we only had the one night before our cruise. We walked easily to Pikes Market, World Market, the drugstore, all the places we wanted to go before our trip. In the morning, we had a very good breakfast at the library cafe with the only negative being an indifferent waiter, not too friendly. All in all, a great stay and I look forward to staying again when I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FarWest604
Reviews.Content: Thanks, Tripadvisor, for helping me pick another winner! Based on thereviews I read here, we booked a 2 night stay at the Alexis before taking a 1-day cruise back home to Vancouver. The location was great - walk to the pike place market, SAM, Nordstrom and Pacific Place shopping centre. Also near to some great pubs and restaurants - see my other reviews on Brooklyn, McCormick & Schmick, and the Biscuit b!tch!. Loved that they had happy hour each evening from 5-6pm in the lobby - free wine or beer! They also do free coffee/tea in the lobby each morning to enjoy on site or to go. While this was a nice touch, I would have preferred an in-room coffee maker so we could have a cup while we were getting ready. The room was beautifully decorated with an enormous bathroom and closet, and a small sitting area and desk.We paid for a standard room, so weren't dissapointed that we didn't have a view. Of course they had the obligatory mini bar which costs a fortune, but if you sign up with their loyalty program they give you a $10 minibar credit and free wifi access. Staff were very helpful, recommending great places to eat and replacing our key card when we forgot ours in the room. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jen M
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets it all right... friendly, knowledgeable staff; lovely property (2 queen room was huge! & well laid out); good location... no small detail has been overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: timh_10
Reviews.Content: Close to shops and restaurants. I have to travel to Seattle several times per year on business. I stay here whenever I can. Great place, great people and a great value. I hope to be able to come back and stay here for pleasure sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: The-Travel-Tot
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that I really love Kimpton hotels. I recently reviewed the Monaco in Portland and could not say enough about how wonderful it was. I was looking forward to this trip with my kids (last time was just as a couple) due to the Kimpton Kids program offered at the hotel. Here is the program in case you are interested: For Kids Each child is greeted with a special KimptonKids welcome gift Comment cards just for kids to tell us what they thought about their stay A list of kid-friendly activities in the area includes parks, restaurants and enriching classes Child-size animal print robes are available for loan or purchase Back to my review: The Good: Great location Nice Style Huge room (chose the 1bdrm suite with sofa bed and 2 bathrooms) Treasure chest of small toys from which my kids could select something The Not So Good Let me preface this by saying that my reservations did specify that we were traveling with two kids 4 and 7. As part of the Kimpton Kids they offer Kids animal print robes. I guess I thought they would be in the room. Instead we had to call and request them. In all fairness the request was dealt with quickly and the robes were delivered. When it came to pulling out the sofa for the kids, we found there was only one extra pillow in the room. Once again we called and request was dealt with promptly. It just seems to me that if there are four people in a room, there should be four pillows. The Ugly When we checked into the hotel it was happy hour in the hotel lobby and there was a wedding going on. The desk staff seemed to be a little distracted. I approached one person and they looked away, I approached the other and had to ask them if I could check in. The wedding, however became a bigger issue. When we returned to our room on the 3rd floor after dinner (around 9:30pm), the turndown staff had left our clock radio on. Unfortunately this did not come even close to drowning out the music from the wedding two floors below. I am a very tolerant person, especially when it comes to someone’s wedding but this noise was too much (I’m not blaming the wedding but the hotel). I can’t imagine what this would have been like in a 2nd floor room. I chose, however, not to complain since I really didn't want to ruin someone's wedding. I finally managed to get to sleep just before midnight only to be woken by an altercation going on in the hotel regarding some woman having a fit about her party being shut down by the hotel and was screeching that she didn't "give a damn about the other hotel guests”. This went on for a good 15 minutes. So basically it was a terrible night and I write this 3 coffees into my day. In all fairness when I complained to the front desk manager in the morning she was sympathetic and said that although she couldn’t adjust our rate (we had prepaid through a 3rd party site) she would be happy to buy us breakfast in the hotel restaurant (although we had already made other plan). It is more an issue to me of how the hotel could think that anyone could sleep under such circumstances. It’s made me re-think how I book a hotel room? Do I need to ask what kind of functions are going on? It seems a bit unreasonable. I know times are touch but perhaps a small hotel such as this (4 floors) is more appropriate for a wine and cheese function than a wedding with a live band or DJ playing the extended dance track. All said, yes, I will still try Kimpton again in the future. Their hotels fit my personality. This visit, however, was sadly a miss for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ghrymm
Reviews.Content: Great location easy walk to Pike Place and shopping. Very friendly people that care ! Nice bar with good food, try the fries with blue chesse and they have Diamond x IPA on tap.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: heathert390
Reviews.Content: I had my first stay at the Alexis last week and I can't wait to go back. The staff was PERFECT - friendly and accomodating. The room was gorgeous - spacious and well decorated. I wish I had stayed long enough to take advantage of their cool ammenities (work out bag delivered to room, wine hour, etc.). The location is also fabulous. Thank you Alexis - you were the bright spot in a very stressful week. I look forward to seeing you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Kevin K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 4 days in Seattle and stayed at the Alexis. A really nice hotel, huge room and great staff. As other reviewers have noted, its location is perfect. Everything is close to the Alexis and most of it can b e done easily by foot....SAFECO stadium, PIke Place Market, the harbor front, ferries, the Art Museum, hop on and hop off bus...The conceirge, Russell, was particularly helpful. The bar was nice, Happy Hour from 4 to 7 with good deals on food. Plus, the usual 5 pm Kimpton wine tasting... If ever again in Seattle, this is the place we will stay. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “they were so nice to my wife and her friends”
Reviews.Author: kamikazee
Reviews.Content: well here it is, the hotel has an unbelievable location, central to all things touristy. i booked this for the girls 50th. this hotel remembered this and suprised them with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. the room was a modern boston harbour, which is how it was described to me, lots of room with two queens for a decent price under $300usd a night. food at the hotel was delicious, people were friendly and there were no snags or concerns, everything worked out as one would wish a perfect vacation to be. i use this site and travel a lot, never have i commented. but this...this was commendable, and i wasn't even there. next time this is where i will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times now for business, and I am continually impressed. The staff is very friendly and accomodating, the rooms are great, and the beds may be the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on! The Alexis is just a couple of blocks from Pike's Market and the waterfront. I do recommend joining InTouch, which is free - this is the only way to get free wi-fi access. Also, if you stay in a Kimpton hotel again, you will get a $10 minibar credit! The restaurant downstairs has good food as well as a good beer selection.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NovaCath
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a King Room for six nights. Bed was comfortable. I am a Kimpton In Touch member so wifi was free in the room for me. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Had plenty of storage space for two. Food was very good. They upgraded the flat screen television during our stay. Hotel location is very good as one can take a short walk to Waterfront and the Washington State Ferry, to the Seattle Art Museum, and to Pike Place Market. We also walked to Safeco Field and to Nordstrom and to Westlake to get the monorail. I have knee issues so I was a little concerned about the hills. It was uphill on First to the market and downhill to the waterfront on Madison. It was flatter on First walking in the direction of Pioneer Square and Safeco Field. Also learned that while the hill between Third and First was steep for me by the hotel, it was a lot less steep if we walked on First to Union before walking over towards Second. The front desk staff called the night before check out to ask if we wanted to take a town car to the airport. We did and it was $40.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think twice”
Reviews.Author: DenverMomasita
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay in this beautiful hotel was perfect. Our suite was enormous and absolutely wonderful. The hotel staff was warm, friendly, helpful in every department. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. The location was perfect for us and we enjoyed much of the city by our own foot transportation. The Alexis Hotel is our new "home" when visiting family and friends in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location downtown near Pike Place Mkt and waterfront”
Reviews.Author: CheffyD
Reviews.Content: No major complaints. Clean. Huge rooms with comfy beds. Only complaints were (1) noise from wedding in hotel conference space -- loud music until early morning hours one night and (2) shower faucet was difficult to operate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Sara P
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is a lovely hotel with friendly staff and a great modern vibe. We went here for a special wedding anniversary trip, and found the suite we booked to be absolutely perfect and well appointed. The hotel also treated us to a split of wine to help us celebrate! Overall, this is a great property that offers a good value for something special in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel -- Great Staff -- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: seattlelover317
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding. Beautiful room – clean and very spacious! The staff were very nice and friendly – answered lots of our questions about the area. The Alexis is in a terrific location – a few blocks away from Pioneer Square and Pikes Market -- well, really easy to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent”
Reviews.Author: Washout
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a wedding party and really enjoyed it. Predictable enough to be comfortable but unique enough to feel like I wasn't on a business trip. The service was reasonable - good, not fantastic but people were pleasant. The food was very good. My only complaint about the room is that you could hear anyone that walked by the room. Otherwise the location doesn't get any better - especially at the price and the room was quite large for having such a great location. They did have FANTASTIC blackout curtains. It could have been high noon and I'd be non the wiser I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidBradley
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Alexis and Kimpton's near-by Monaco and these are both really great hotels. The Alexis shines in the areas that Kimpton Hotels do so well: excellent staff service; rooms with stylish decor that distinguish them from average hotel rooms; and great on-site restaurants. The Alexis is located closer to Pike Street market and the water than the Monaco. The Monaco's restaurant is larger. The Monaco is slightly more expensive. Whether you choose the Alexis or the Monaco, its hard to go wrong with either hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeFF
Reviews.Content: Seattle was the last of three stops on our trip to the Pacific Northwest and the Alexis was the best hotel we stayed at on the trip. Great room, quiet, spacious, clean. The hotel bar is a gem. Staff were gracious and accomodating. Great location right in the heart of all the Seattle action too. When we're back in Seattle, we'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Enjoyingthegoodlife
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in a suite at the Alexis. The hotel is conveniently located in downtown Seattle not far from the Pike Place Market or any other tourist destination for that matter. Our room was comfortable, well equipped and had a lovely 2-person, step up Jacuzzi tub. They have fabulously scented premier bath and shower products. The staff was friendly, helpful and advised us once we checked in of the free wine hour and morning coffee. Parking was your typical hotel price, but then the city and the state added taxes to the taxes. I could have had a nice meal by the time I paid to park my car for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Willie'sMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! We stayed for 3 nights the end of August and again on September 3, 2011. This is definitely a five star. The rooms are very well appointed. If you find you need something all you need to do is ask and the service is outstanding. The consignier, Russell, is so professional, helpful and accomodating. Wine and chocolates for our anniversary - can't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant”
Reviews.Author: LaJuneBug2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & good location. Love the bar either next door or part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bailey92101
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfectly located on 1st Ave, convenient to Pike Market, Pioneer square and a light rail station. The room I stayed in was small, but was fine for me traveling solo. No view, other than the building next to me and the street. The hotel was quiet and the staff was pleasant enough, I had to ask for a map that the couple in front of me were offered. Nice touches like free happy hour with wine every afternoon. Overall a very pleasant stay, in a unique hotel. Note: the doors to the rooms are very heavy!

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to Seattle hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Khaili
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here multiple times for business and/or pleasure and absolutely love it. It is a beautiful property, prime location, and has very nice staff. Always a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: vinoman
Reviews.Content: We've never been disappointed with Kimpton's hotels. We loved the modern feel to the furnishings in the room. We also loved its proximity to the Pike Place Market and Le Panier French Bakery (especially it's Pain Chocolat)!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: paeok
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel, service, location, room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LaurelCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The stay was wonderful. The room was comfortable, the staff helpful. The wine hour was a lovely touch. I'm very picky and this hotel pleased me completely! Russell the concierge was very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is a wonderful hotel close to Seattle's best restaurants and shopping, including the Pike Place Market. It's also near the water - a great place to go for a morning run along the pathway. Our room was tasteful and quiet. The staff were friendly and professional. Without hesitation, we recommend the Alexis.

Reviews.Title: “Presidential feel”
Reviews.Author: DoubleAK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights of our honeymoon and loved our spa suite. The room was beautiful, the bathroom huge and opulent, the bed comfortable. They took good care of us, and we'd recommend it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: carolanne04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kimpton with our children (11, 8) and had a wonderful the time. The room was spacious, the location allowed us to walk to lots of fun places and the service was the real stand out. We were there for my husband's birthday and the kids had a banner they wanted to hang. I forgot to bring something to hang it and asked it they had tape at the front desk. They told me they would take care of everything. When we arrived back to the room after dinner, they had not only hung up the sign but they left a bottle of wine and chocolates for my husband along with little bags of goodies for the kids. Even when we went down for their happy hour, they had sodas for the kids. We couldn't have asked for a better weekend! Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in downtown Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: thwhite2000
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. It's a short walk to the market, the waterfront, and all the shopping at Pike and 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Get bumped from our reserved hotel to the Alexis!! What a lucky move!”
Reviews.Author: jimstooth
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is a great hotel!! Nicely done rooms, we had a king spa suite, couldn't have been happier! Wine happy hour was great. Staff was very nice. Location is good, about 5-6 blocks from the Market, so good walking distance to everything. Highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to love it, but didn't ...”
Reviews.Author: euronovice
Reviews.Content: My husband, new baby and I stayed here 10 years ago and loved this artsy, elegant hotel. We were delighted to have the opportunity to return, now with our five children. Perhaps my sentimental expectations were too high, but we were profoundly disappointed. We had a an executive suite connecting to a double/double ($700 plus per night pre-tax) PLUS another double/double for our nanny (ANOTHER $320ish per night pre-tax) The service was terrible, with one little thing snowballing into the next and here they are: First, the hotel is on a busy downtown street with no pull-off area to unload a vehicle, I had to run inside to track down the valet during Seattle rush hour while my hubby and remaining family got honked at while idling in front of the hotel. Once in our rooms, the valet didn't bother to ask which bag went where -- just unloaded them all in the living room area. (i redirected). I asked abour our crib. He didn't know if there were cribs. He didn't know if the hotel had mini fridges available either . He said he would ask. He never did, so I tracked down the cribs. I was told by the front desk there were no mini fridges (i doubt this is true). We had two bath towels in each bathroom for a family of 7. I did get more 45 minutes after my request. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows. They are elegant and attractive. They are not practical. There is no closet or chest of drawers in the exec. suite bedroom (it's in the living area). The bed -- while comfortable -- takes up most of the room. There is only very limited counter space in the bathroom. It is an older tub shower. The worst was our second floor location directly above busy First Street. The first night (a Sat.) was unbearable. We couldn't sleep but the front desk said it would be better the second night (a Sun) as there had been a parade and festival downtown on Sat. The front desk manager said she'd look around for other available rooms, but never bothered to call back. Despite mostly great reviews on TA, the most frequent negative was the noise which most reviewers assigned to passing garbage trucks. I was told via email in advance of our trip that our room requirements left the hotel with no choice but 2nd floor (lowest floor) rooms for us. But I was also told the garbage trucks had been rescheduled and this was no longer a hotel problem. Nonetheless, at 3 or 4 a.m. both nights we heard something that sounded like a garbage truck! I did not get out of bed to verify. On day 2, I asked for fans which helped drown out the noise on night two. As we essentially had a 2-bedroom suite, there were three different TVs. All used different operating systems (lodgenet, etc.) so what was available on one was not necessarily available on the other. The maintenance man, originally summoned to fix the broken AC in one room, confirmed the other TVs weren't broken. He did not know why they were on different systems. On Sunday morning at 8:30, I went to the lobby for some of the highly-touted iced coffee. It is promoted everywhere as being offered until 10 a.m. on the weekends, including on a sign on the table where the coffee is served. The pitcher was empty. I asked at the front desk and was told there wasn't any more. I said you can't run out of iced coffee unless you've run out of coffee, which is impossible in Seattle. She insisted they were, so I asked to see the manager on duty. After a punitive 10-minute wait, the m.o.d. came out and said it meant they would have to brew more then ice it down (yes! this is the complex recipe for iced coffee). She said it could take several minutes. I told her we'd be in the hotel restaurant. About 20 minutes later, she did bring it to me. We also had 4 $20 restaurant vouchers for b'fast as part of our package. I asked if we could use them for room service instead to spare the other guests the agony of dining next to our boisterous clan of 8. We were told no, which is how we ended up in the restaurant served by a cheerless waitress who brought GLASSES of ice water to everyone , including our one year old and two year olds in high chairs. When we asked her to take them away so the kids didn't knock them over, she knocked one over herself, getting the table and two people wet. No apology, but at least she gave herself an 18 percent tip for our "convenience." The hotel's listed amenities include turndown service at night and a newspaper in the morning. We received neither. When I mentioned this at check out, the woman behind the desk said "you have to request those." How would one know to do this? The only "break" i caught was when I ran out of milk for our baby after 6 p.m. which is when Seattle rolls up the carpet for the night. The Bookstore Bar bartender had mercy on me and filled up my 4oz sippy cup gratis. BTW, it is a beautiful, cozy, warm and charming bar. If I were traveling with my spouse only, we definitely would have had a drink or two there. On the plus side, the hotel is convenient to Pike's Place. It does have a great bar. The beds are comfy. As I learned from other TA reviewers, you do get a $10 minibar credit and free wifi if you join kimpton in touch, which we did. You can check facebook for a password that will get you another perk. In July, it was "flip flops" which got us either two glasses of wine or a movie. No time for either but our tots enjoyed two half hour episodes of "Dora the Explorer," which otherwise would have cost us $2.99 each (seriously).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but quite pricey”
Reviews.Author: Munchkin033
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely fabulous. Just a few blocks walk to the pike place market and surrounded by some great restaurants. We were there during the parade and it was a pain to try to get across the other side of town back to the hotel. We brought our little dog and there was a bed and bowls with a treat waiting when we arrives. The room was smaller than we expected but it was comfy and clean. We were on the 4th floor looking at other rooms and it was quiet and pleasant. I was a little bit confuse at first as there are 2 entrances. I'm not walking very well after a surgery and the Madison street enterance was not too friendly for me as there are only stairs and it is uphill walking to the front entrance. It is on the pricey side but overall it was a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect Kimpton hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TINKTIPTON
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I met in Seattle to escape from the heat of Texas (my state) and North Carolina (her's). I booked the Alexis because of the great experiences I've had at their other properties. The Alexis was the perfect choice for sightseeing Seattle since it's centrally located to just about everything there is to do or see there. Upon check-in, we were given a huge Queen/Queen Deluxe room with a large, comfortable sitting area. The beds were FANTASTIC! Great night's sleep!! Our room overlooked First Avenue, but we were never bothered by traffic noise. The bathroom was spacious and had all the amenities we could ever need. Our housekeeper even arrange our toiletries in to delightful animal and flower creations made from the fresh towels she'd bring. What a gem!! The Alexis had complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning, refreshing tea and water each afternoon, and a wine hour each early evening. Neither of us brought pets, but our hearts were made happy seeing the water bowl and treats laid out for visiting pooches. We arrived in Seattle before our room was ready, so the hotel graciously held our bags while we enjoyed a snack and drink the the Library Bistro. The bartender was friendly and offered us suggestions for dining and sightseeing during our visit. We only had breakfast once at the Alexis but we thoroughly enjoyed our meal. Everything was so fresh!! I love Kimpton hotels and know I will always be pleased with the experience, and the Alexis created another delightful hotel memory for us! It will always be my first choice for a hotel in Seattle!!

Reviews.Title: “A FIREPLACE in our BEDROOM - plus chocolates & champagne!”
Reviews.Author: nikkilynn8
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at! My husband and I were in Seattle for one evening before heading out to the Olympic mountains to celebrate our anniversary, and we chose to stay at the Alexis due to its proximity to Pike Place Market. When I made the reservation they asked if it was for a special occasion, and I told them it was our anniversary. I also had several questions while booking: how far from Pike Place, is it safe to walk to Pike Place at night, what's the best way to get to the ferry dock, what is their parking policy, etc. The agent answered all my questions and was courteous and friendly. I booked the room, and when we arrived: - there were chocolates in our room - they'd given us free champagne - the room had a fireplace! - the room was clean and very comfortable - the bathrooms are amazing They're also pet friendly so if we go back with our dog we'll be staying there (they have treats and water for the dog upon arrival). The bellman at the front was friendly, and the valet was prompt and took good care of our rental car. We enjoyed sleeping with the windows open and the fireplace lit, and snuggled up to enjoy our anniversary together. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BillSlazo
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Alexis in June 2011 for 4 nights. All of the nice downtown Seattle hotels are quite expensive and charge steeply for parking privileges. However the Alexis is competively priced and is located on First Avenue, a short walk away from Pike Place and/or the Waterfront area.Our room was very nice and spacious (there really aren't any rooms with great views because of surrounding tall buildings). The hotel staff and service were awesome, I recommend this hotel to any traveler in Seattle who would prefer to be in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: syleach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis for a total of 5 nights in early July 2011. The front desk was courteous and absolutely accomodating. We had a minor issue the first night as there was a dog barking for a couple hours during the day in the room next to ours. We asked if we could be moved to another room just in case the barking continued into the night. The Alexis was more than willing to move us and even upgraded our room. The bed was comfortable and the room was very inviting. We had drinks one night at the bar in the Alexis (The Library) and the bartender was very helpful and sweet. The Alexis is a great hotel in a great location. We will be back to Seattle and back to the Alexis!

Reviews.Title: “An experience back in time”
Reviews.Author: JimB58
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the Alexis in early June. The hotel is located in a great location, near Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square. Lots of touristy things to do within walking distance of the hotel. The Alexis has a historic feel, but is extremely well maintained. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our large room with a very comfortable bed. I'm not usually a fan of boutique hotels, but the Alexis was a perfect fit for a visit to Old Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: kolekona
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night one the eve of the Seattle to Portland Classic bike ride and we couldn't have made a better choice. Huge, beautifully appointed rooms, extremely helpful staff, dog friendly property, close proximity to the waterfront, Pike Place Market, and Pioneer Square. Very nice place. We will probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday road trip through beautiful Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: cwiertny2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent July 4th and 5th at the wonderful Alexis Hotel as we drove up the Pacific Coast for her 40th birthday. Having stayed at Kimpton hotels in the past, and being a current Kimpton InTouch member, I was aware of the amazing accommodations and customer service that I could expect to receive. However, the Alexis was somehow able to still exceed those expectations. I had booked our King Deluxe room online (with AAA discounted parking) and at the time noted that this would be a special occasion. Upon arrival to the hotel, which happens to be in a great, highly accessible part of downtown Seattle, we we're greeted by Travis, a super friendly and informative valet/bellman. Through the duration of our stay, Travis was there to recommend activities and restaurants, answer questions and talk to us about our trip we were currently enjoying. Travis truly helped make our stay in Seattle so much more enjoyable! But this was just the beginning. Once at the front desk, we were welcomed with a friendly birthday greeting for my wife and a super smooth check-in. We we're given our keys and headed to our room. Upon arrival, we we're floored to see that we had been given an amazing upgrade to a one bedroom suite! This corner suite was beautiful and just happened to be bigger than many of the apartments my wife and I lived in not so long ago when we we're just starting out. We really enjoyed spending time lounging in the living room during our rests between trips to the waterfront, Pike Market, the amazing public library (a must see if you love architecture or taking pictures, or both, like us) or our small side day trip to Snowqualmie Falls. There was all kinds of art throughout the suite and our separate bedroom and classy looking bathroom were just the right size and super beautiful as well! Yet one last amazing touch to mention took place upon returning to our room on our stay's first night. We returned to find a Birthday note, fresh fruit and sparking wine to celebrate my wife's birthday... how cool is that? Many thanks to Louisa, a concierge at the Alexis, for making my wife feel so special! I could go on and on and on, but need to wrap this thing up! SO... if you're looking for a great hotel in Seattle that has it ALL, location, amenities, beautiful rooms and an excellent and amazingly friendly staff, I guess the Alexis is your hotel. It's really that simple. I'm SO glad we chose the Alexis as our Seattle home away from home! E. Cwiertny Huntington Beach, CA

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: alaskan_traveler2012
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton Hotel chain is one line of hotels you can always count on. They are each unique and very, very nice. The Alexis hotel is in a prime location for downtown walking. The room itself is very clean, modern, and they always have soft towels! I like the chain mostly because each room looks like it just came out of a decor magazine. They have great wifi too.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience I've EVER had!”
Reviews.Author: DougSobie
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight trip to Seattle (I'd never been there previously), and haing stayed in a Kimpton Hotel previously, I chose the Alexis. What a great decision. The location was perfect, the price amazed me for such a nice hotel, and the room was tremendous. But the best thing about it was the staff. I was there for one night and a lunch meeting the next day, followed by 10 hours to kill before a red-eye flight. It was during those 10 hours that the staff set their property apart. Their helpfulness in every area insured that I'll always stay in a Kimpton property if I can. They let me sore my bags and gave me easy access. They found a place for me to change and get organized (well after I checked out). They gave me numerous recommendations for places to o and things to do. I know that most high end hotels do these things, but it was the friendly attitude that made such an impression. Overall, the location, price, or quality of the room would have been enough to get me back. But when you get everything AND great service, it makes me want to tell everyone I know about The Alexis and Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller3204
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2 night stay at the Alexis hotel, on the 6th floor. Check in smooth and all staff we encountered very helpful. We had a view of the harbour from our room. We ate breakfast at the hotel both mornings, which we enjoyed. Happy hour was a chance to meet fellow travellers. There were old fashioned games on the table for guests to play and blank postcards with watercolour paints to create your own postcard! Nice touch. One night happy hour was a fun raiser for genetic research for new born infants. Very nice idea. We went to the Bookstore bar for a drink in the evenings and that had a really nice atmosphere. Good location, close to Pike Market and other sight seeing spots. I enjoyed my stay at the Alexis.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Alexxi8
Reviews.Content: We're big Kimpton fans - I believe this was our 5th city. We were traveling with 2 older kids (boy & girl). My son & husband are both 6'5" & about 300 lbs, so sleeping arrangements on a budget are tricky. We had a 1 BR, 1 Bath suite with a foldout sofa & rollaway, which worked great. Living room had a fireplace & was HUGE! bedroom was small, but bed was comfy. Bath, like most Kimptons' was pretty small. Extra sink on the living room bar really came in handy with 4 people in room. Only negative to the room - absolutely no drawers! Had counters, cubbies & hanging space to spare, but not a drawer in sight. Free wine happy hour at 5 - 6 PM is a Kimpton plus. One negative on the hotel bar, our 21-year old, with our permission, ordered a $14 Scotch. BOY were we surprised when it showed up on our bill as a $30 version of the same brand. He had clearly ordered the lesser version. The server just said "that's what I brought him" & made no effort to correct the problem. We suspect this server frequently makes this same "mistake" & complained to the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WhiteRaven8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alexis Hotel on a business trip. My husband is a Klimpton member, and we chose this hotel partly because we would get free internet access, and also because the hotel has a wine happy hour every evening. We were very pleased with everything about the Alexis. The staff were very gracious, our room was lovely, and the location of the hotel was within walking distance of Pike's Place Market, Pioneer Plaza, the waterfront, the commuter train, and wonderful restaurants. We loved the hotel's focus on local art. We also enjoyed the cozy leopard pring robes provided. Everything was just perfect. We would definately stay at the Alexis on our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and dog needed a getaway.”
Reviews.Author: skluger
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel prior to booking to check their policy on leaving my dog in the room. I knew this was the place to stay when they said that if our dog was noisy while we were at the Mariner's game they would bring him to the lobby to keep him company. When we checked in they knew who we were based upon the description of my dog. The room was modern and comfortable. The location, 5 minutes from Pike's Market, 20 minutes from Safeco and 2 minutes from the waterfront is ideal for getting out for a walk. Valet parking and door service were just icing on the cake for a nice stay in Seattle to see a baseball game.

Reviews.Title: “Alexis, Good location, Nice hotel, You will like it.”
Reviews.Author: swixo
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is where I stay when in Seattle. I visit about every other month and always stay here. The staff is exceptional - front desk - bell staff - restaurant, they know how to take care of you. Most rooms are unique, furnishings and layout. The boutique design of this hotel influences the higher end look of each room. The beds are very nice and the rooms are all very good, even the smaller ones. You will feel comfortable here. Dogs seem welcome to stay with you in your room. Free internet. Enjoy a drink and dinner in the bookstore bar restaurant, its really nice. Rates are good for a hotel of this quality in Seattle. Coffee in the lobby in the AM and Wine tasting at night. Hotel would get 5-stars from me if it had in-room coffee, which they used to provide. Make no mistake - they excel at everything else. Some rooms have street noise issues, you are downtown on a busy street. Easy walk to everything. Car service and Taxi available always right outside.

Reviews.Title: “The Alexis is the only place we stay when in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: chooming
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 34th anniversary with a trip to Seattle and Victoria, BC from May 26 to June 2. The hotel staff made our trip a wonderful and mermorial occassion. We highly recommend staying at this great hotel, the staff go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rvbolorin
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent; easy walk to waterfront , Pikeplace and free buses that take you everywhere. The room was big and comfortable, vanity in bathroom was broke and scratched but rest of room and bathroom was clean, looked new and well decorated. Staff is friendly and helpful. Very pleasant experience, will go back when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: c_lew41
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an average hotel don not look at the Alexis as this one is a phenomal hotal. The rooms are sexy and welcoming. The Bookstore Bar is the perfect retreat but the serveice is what really sets this location apart from any other hotel in Seattle. Monica, Lyndsay, Marissa and Holly at the fron dest will ensure a posative reseption and from there you can count on Russell to get you around the city. Evey need was meet and by in large anticipated. Such a great experiance!

Reviews.Title: “What a marvelous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo9213
Reviews.Content: The Alexis was a wonderful place to base out of for a relaxing getaway to Seattle. Everything from check-in to (didn't really want to) departure was easy, cordial and friendly. The doorman even let us borrow an umbrella to get to dinner when a big shower came in earlier than expected. The staff were all upbeat and seemed genuinely pleased to be serving the guests. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Style, good location.”
Reviews.Author: U2Fan_11
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. It is a short walk to Pike's Market, the waterfront, or a game at Safeco Field or Qwest Stadium. I have traveled for business and used this hotel and found that the hotel design is such that each floor has many different layouts, sizes and styles. The simplest room is very nice and comfortable, but some of the larger rooms are nothing short of spectacular with fireplaces, large sitting rooms, jetted tubs, and a few suites are sponsored by local interests. There is a room sponsored by the Museum and contains unique art; another by the symphony and contains a grand piano; another by a radio station (I stayed in this one) that contained rock and roll history items. Some rooms have exposed brick walls and artistic stainless steel beds. Staff is friendly and there is a complimentary wine hour each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Epic, Modern, Unique. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTrek-dot-org
Reviews.Content: We loved, loved, loved this place and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Seattle on our next visit. The common areas: lobby, restaurant, hotel bar, etc are all unique. Not at all run of the mill. Very fitting for Seattle and also this area of Seattle with the Art Museum across the street. Like the common areas, the rooms are also uniquely designed and appointed. We had a suite which was great with our 2 kids. Location fabulous. Walked to Pikes every morning for breakfast and to the waterfront each afternoon. Hotel staff jumped to respond to any request we made. For more of our thoughts on the Alexis and travel to Seattle check our post on FamilyTrek.org at http://bit.ly/kgmPt2

Reviews.Title: “Cute and funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sensesawaken
Reviews.Content: On my visits to Seattle, I have always walked pass this hotel and on this ttrip I decided to stay in this hotel. I arrived Seattle late in the evening and checked into Alexis, the receptionist check me in promptly and I discovered I was given a handicap room. spacious but well adapted for handicap. For me , the sink was too small and shallow to use. The room was well appointed and I must give a thumbs up to this hotel for being enviromental friendly. The receptionist and the hotel porters were very helpful. The location of the hotel is good as its within walking distance to the waterfront. The rooms are well appointed and I would stay in this hotel again but I would make sure it would not be a handicap room again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels I have ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: Raleightwins
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Alexis Hotel in Seattle based on the excellent Trip Advisor reviews and it was EVEN BETTER than I expected. The room/suite was gorgeous and huge and there was a fireplace in the sitting area. Firewood was brought to our room so we could enjoy a nightly fire. There were goodies for my children upon check-in which I thought was great. The bathrooms were immaculate and the whole place was very clean!! The staff was very friendly and the breakfasts were delicious, a little pricey but very good! I am very picky about the comfort of beds in hotel and this bed was VERY comfy and firm- perfect! It was a very important trip for me and my first time to Seattle and I would never stay anywhere else when I return to this fun city!! It is also within walking distance to lots of other things and restaurants and coffee shops. Definitely book a room here!! You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, perfect Seattle location.”
Reviews.Author: lsand23
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is beautiful and located within walking distance of the Seattle Art Museum, the public library, Pike Place Market and the downtown area. Great restaurants all around, including the two within the hotel. Our room was very nice, roomy and comfortable. Staff is super friendly and helpful. This is the place I will stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL FOR HONEYMOON!!!”
Reviews.Author: agarrison84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis for the first part of our honeymoon, the rest of our trip was on a cruise. The hotel staff was very friendly & helpful in every way. We arrived before check in and our room wasn’t quite ready so they stored our bags for us & we walked around for a bit. When we returned, several hours later, they remembered our names & asked how if we enjoyed their restaurant suggestion. We had several bags so we were taken to our room & told someone would bring our bag up shortly. We loved our room & the great bathroom! The huge 2 person tub was so nice & very deep, the glass shower, and marble sink was also very nice. The bed was very comfortable as well. The ceilings were very high, the window coverings were very neutral and pretty. We had a great view of the sound from our room. The second night a staff member delivered champagne & fruit to our room as a congrats from the hotel! The champagne was horrible but the fruit was great. We had some problem with our phone not working when we tried to call for room service. They called us right back took our order & said they would send someone to fix our phone. Within minutes some was knocking on our door to check it out. Our house keeper even left us a note & a towel animal on our last night! I was very pleased with the Alexis & we hope to get to visit again someday & bring our dog Daisy along to see Seattle!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: efghij
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is truly a lovely hotel. The staff is helpful and upbeat. Our suite was great fun and creatively designed;it was large and comfortable. facing 1st Street. We found it convenient for walks in the city. Breakfast in "The Library" was delicious and the staff attentive and helpful. Unfortunately, our room was in a cul-de-sac with five other rooms, at least two or three of which were filled with a boisterous wedding party. On the Saturday night, screaming and door banging went on for several hours after midnight, as drunk after drunk arrived for the fun. One call to the front desk was answered with an assurance that security would come. However, it went on for another one and one-half hours. When my husband called, he was told that the security had come up and heard nothing. What!! Things did eventually settle down, but by then sleep was impossible.The next day a cart was left outside in the hall with 25 to 50 empty wine glasses, part of a set up provided by the hotel. We peeked into one of the rooms the maid was cleaning and saw a huge suite with room for a major party. The hotel concierge did try to make amends the next night with a bottle of wine and cheese plate left in our room, a very nice gesture. However it strikes us that if a large group is going to be an obvious problem, other guests should be housed elsewhere in the building. In fairness, this scenario has been a problem in other Seattle hotels on weekends, but we resent paying for a disrupted night after a long trip.

Reviews.Title: “Alexis, awesome in every way!”
Reviews.Author: punkinlr
Reviews.Content: We, wife and I, arrived on a Thursday, spending four nights in Seattle. Not sure where to start so I'll make this short and to the point. The Alexis is an awesome hotel. The staff outstanding in every way. Staff includes desk, restaurant, housekeeping, concierge, etc. The room was fantatstic with a view of the Sound. Location is absolutely excellent, within walking distance to Pike Place Market, waterfront, Safeco stadium, and light rail. The Bookstore Bar and Library Bistro were outstanding as well. I could go on and on, but I think you get the picture, this is the place to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Celebration Made Special”
Reviews.Author: NamasteEloise
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Alexis for a celebration, and the care, consideration and special touches provided by the staff at the hotel was fabulous. One nice gesture after another greeted us, including cards and treats. The room was comfortable, spacious and a perfect location to chosen activities. We had a challenge with the bathroom vanity and it was attended to quickly. The artwork throughout the hotel adds beauty and class. Kimpton Hotels are a unique and special treat, and the In Touch loyalty program makes it even more beneficial.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: meowmeow1113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis this weekend and it was lovely. The lobby was very pretty and the bar staff was super! Our room was gorgeous overlooking busy 1st avenue(made for great people watching)! The giant king size bed was so comfy I could have slept all day. The location could not have been better! You are basically steps to the waterfront and just blocks from the Market and Pioneer Square! I loved this place however it was unfortunate that we were charged for making a local telephone call(literally called 2 blocks away). Also we were charged an extra $100.00 which was not shown on my receipt but did appear on my bank statement. I called the Alexis to inquire and was told that it was an authorization fee that would be reimbursed in a couple of days. Other than that this place is truly beautifull!

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Alkalinesky
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing time at this hotel. The staff was polite, accomodating, and always available no matter what time of day or night or how strange our requests. The room was one of the most beautiful I've ever seen. The decor was classical with perfectly apportioned modern touches. We didn't have a dog with us, but the hotel was very dog-friendly. They even provided a treat bowl and water bowl at the front entrance with a chalk board of all the visiting canines listed. So cute! Everything was wonderful. I can't imagine staying anywhere else while in Seattle. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Alexis Seattle - another great Kimpton Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MarkkOBrown
Reviews.Content: We are frequent guests at Kimpton properties in Seattle but this was first time ever at Alexis. We were very pleased. It's a great location (two blocks to waterfront, four blocks from Pike Place Market, three blocks from Pioneer Square, easy walk to Mariners or Sea Hawks stadiums and 5th Avenue Theater) and the staff we super front front door, front desk, restaurant and even the service personnel we talked to in the elevator. The room (one King bed) was large, lots of windows and nice lighting. Our only request was a quiet room and that it was. Couple of small matters - the pillows were too soft and the 5pm Manager's reception was wine only, no soft drinks, water, crackers and olives like at most Kimptons. Overall this was super Hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, staff, and comforts of any hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: TheTuffs
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Alexis Hotel! It is our preferred hotel when we stay in the Seattle area. The front desk staff is amazingly helpful and friendly. Lyndsay is always eager to greet us and say hello to our chocolate lab (who feels like quite the queen when she gets to stay at the hotel with us). The hotel is always spotless, beautiful, and comfortable. I couldn't say enough great things about this hotel and will continue to encourage all of our family and friends to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “From one innkeeper to another...GREAT job!”
Reviews.Author: EarthboxLaura
Reviews.Content: As an innkeeper, I'm very particular about where I stay and notice all the details. And Alexis shines all the way around. From the moment you drive up and one of the helpful valets takes care of you to the friendly front-desk staff and the super helpful concierge who can give you all his inside tips on where to dine, you'll know you're staying at the right place. Nicely done!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: Nigeldoggy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, 3/19-3/21. As everyone say's, it's a perfect location. EVERY employee was cheerful and more than willing to help. Initially chose the Alexis because of their pet policies (which are on par with Four Seasons) but I would stay there, sans dogs, very easily. Room was remarkable and spacious. Received an upgrade for being an In Touch member as well as a discounted room rate. Highly recommend joining. Great decor, ambiance, clean, excellent amenities and as mentioned, friendly, willing staff. Only hotel I will live in whilst in my favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,big rooms,tiny gym”
Reviews.Author: Huckle
Reviews.Content: I loved the location and the rooms were spacious and clean. There is free starbucks coffee in the lobby every day and wine in the afternoon. The bar is lively and comfortable. The hotel is an easy walk to the water where there is a path that leads into a park, great for jogging, biking, dog walking, etc. There are many restaurants and plenty of shopping close by. The hotel is a very short walk to Pike's market. The valet service for the car was excellent-we never waited more than five minutes for the car. The gym was very disappointing- a timy, tiny room with four pieces of equipment-if two people were in there at the same time-it was crowded. The hotel could use a small amount of updating and we were only able to open one of three windows. I would recommend this hotel due to its location and great value.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhodyBooks
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of Pike's Place Market and tons of restaurants. Fabulous service, attentive and helpful desk people, as usual with Kimpton. I've never been disappointed with them. Very spacious room, nicely appointed, sparkling clean. Good mattress, great pillows, excellent black-out curtains blocked all light; our 3rd floor room was very quiet even though it faced the street. Tons of interesting art in the hallways and rooms. Free wine bar happy hour, as usual with Kimpton. Free newspapers laid out in lobby- good selection (NY Times, USA Today, Wall Street Journal, Seattle Times) Free wi-fi and $10 mini-bar coupon for in-touch members, which you can sign up for on the spot if you're not already a member. We booked 3 rooms for 2 adult couples and 2 teens - all family members were very happy with their stay and with their rooms. Pets are allowed, and we occasionally saw one coming or going but never heard barking.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Kimpton Property”
Reviews.Author: getmeoutoftherain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a deluxe king room. Traveling with a very large dog, I thought we might be put in an older room. Well, I certainly do not think that this was the case. The room was beautiful and very spacious. We were on the 4th floor and the room actually had a tiny balcony that one could sit out on. The view would only be to the back of the Seattle Times building, but it was nice to be able to open the door and get some fresh air. We had the door to the balcony ajar at night, and I really didn't hear much street noise. Perhaps a siren, and seagulls in the morning. Blackout curtains keep the room dark, if you would like it that way. All of the linens were very good quality. My only complaint was trying the find a pillow I liked. There is a mixture of soft and firms ones. I finally figured that out the second night. True, the toiletries are in refillable containers, but who cares. The shower was huge, with a rainhead shower faucet. Placed in the room was a dog bed, 2 dog dishes and a couple of dog biscuits. One of them from a dog bakery, with the name of the hotel on it. Okay..if you don't like dogs, you'll see no positive in this. In the lobby there is a water bowl and a bowl filled with dog biscuits. As we left the dog in the car when we went out to eat, the valets were great at taking us down and up to the car, to deal with our dog. The front desk staff, concierge, and valets were incredibly professional. They were there when you needed them, but not overbearing. Staff in the Library Bistro were friendly and efficient. We ate both nights at the Library Bistro. Actually made it in for Happy Hour and then stayed afterwards. Food great and a good variety of beer on tap. Location was excellent for us. One block from the waterfront which is fantastic for walking or running. About 3 blocks from Pike Market, 3 to Pioneer Square. A little longer to the malls, but the buses in the the downtown core are free and easy to take. Yes, the parking is $36 but what major city does not have steep parking prices. Sure you can move your car around to other lots, but we didn't wan the hassle of that. I now have my favorite hotel in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful sophisticated boutique hotel to stay at in seattle.”
Reviews.Author: amberforke
Reviews.Content: The Alexis hotel located in downtown Seattle is a gem of a hotel. The staff is always friendly and goes above what is required of them. The decor is modern and the rooms have everything a traveller could want: comfortable beds, mini bar, on-demand movies, room service, robes, free wireless internet, and are always exceptionally clean. The hotel also accepts pets. I've been greeted by golden retrievers and black labs upon check-in which was a pleasant surprise. The hotel is also walking distance to great restaurants (the hotel's bookstore cafe is one of my favorites), shopping, and has easy access to highways. Highly recommend if you like boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Spa rooms are amazing and spacious”
Reviews.Author: TouringComplete
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our wedding anniversary because of the big in-room hot tub and the location. The bathroom was as large as entire hotel rooms I've stayed in elsewhere. The hot tub was spacious and clean. The rest of the room was also spacious. The rooms are modern and have nice artwork, yet have a classic feel. The room service breakfast was good as well. The only downside were that the soundproofing was. distinctly lacking in the vertical dimension and it sounded like furniture was being moved above. (The sounds did not interrupt our sleep.) The room didn't have much of a view, but we did not ask/pay for a view. There was a surprise on the check. We were only charged half of the (high) $36 valet parking fee. I inquired as to the nature of this pleasant surprise and was told that they parking a hybrid is half price.

Reviews.Title: “Solid all around hotel, great place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: Kristin E
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a Kimpton Hotel and overall we were very pleased. Our suite was huge, way bigger than we expected. The bedding was very comfortable, although the pillows left something to be desired...they were the feather type that have almost no stuffing in them so you really need a few. My wife is pregnant so she had to call down to the front desk to get some foam pillows sent up, which they did very promptly. Street noise was a minor problem, at least until the traffic died down, but that occurred reasonably early and it never disturbed my sleep. WiFi Internet was free if you join their loyalty program, which was A-OK w/ me. I hate when fine hotels nickel and dime you on stuff like internet when cheapy hotels just give you that for free. The provided soaps, shampoos etc were nice. This hotel has chosen to move away from the mini-bottles in favor of a large bottle they refill every day. They claim it is to help eliminate the wastefulness of all those bottles going in a landfill. I think it does that and probably saves them a boatload of cash at the same time. Either way, this is an example of environmentalism that I can get behind. My stay was not affected by this in the slightest, so bravo to them for eliminating waste in ways that don't sacrifice the quality of their service. The front desk staff was pretty friendly but the bellmen/doormen didn't seem too interested in doing their job. We found that they try to steer people towards the town cars (presumably because they get a kick back on) even though taxis are much cheaper. In several cases when we were leaving they weren't available to help hail a cab or anything. In a hotel that charges what the Alexis does, this doesn't seem like the level of service I expect. The doorman needs to stop flirting with the girl at the front desk and help me flag down a taxi...seriously there's a tip in it for you. We only ordered room service twice during our stay, once just for a late night dessert and then again for breakfast the next morning. In both cases, the delivery time was amazingly short....so fast that I had to hide in the bathroom with a towel wrapped around me while my wife let them in. LOL. I wasn't expecting them so soon. :) Food quality was excellent and the fast delivery made sure it didn't taste like it had sat around for a long time. I'd like to point out that the staff, overall, was very attentive (doormen aside). We had a couple small requests that were fulfilled immediately...literally as fast as someone could possibly do it. Honestly, the only place I've had better service was at the Four Seasons, so I really do think they deserve recognition at the Alexis.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel nearby the Pike Place Market”
Reviews.Author: Mosespa
Reviews.Content: The location is really good, just 5 minutes walk from the Pike Place Market, the Seatlle Art Museum & the Underground tour. Our room was in the newest "tower" just by the elevator (n° 341) It was pretty spacious, with a modern design (we even had an iPod station with speakers as an alarm)and very clean. The sound proofing is also great, as we didn't hear any noise during the 2 nights we stayed there (either from the street or from the elevator). The bed was perfect, neither to soft nor too hard, with 6 different pillows, so you can really choose, according to your taste. Staff is nice & helpful. The only "problem" is that the wi-fi wasn't working really in the room (it was on an ipod, might be better with a laptop though).

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Alexis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackcat1972
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a week and stayed at the Alexis. As a disclaimer, I will tell you I am a fan of the Kimpton group and feel they do an outstanding job. We have stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle previously and decided to try something different. The Alexis was well designed and comfortable. We had a deluxe king overlooking Spring street from the second floor. The room was very large, with a separate sittling room. The bed was comfortable and the room met all of our needs. The location of the hotel is great! A few short blocks and you are at the piers, at pike place market, or at SAM (seattle museum of art). The hotel restaurant only serves breakfast, but there is a cute little bar a that served nice snacks. Cheese plates, blue cheese French fries (yum!), and other bar snacks. Needles to say there are also plenty of choices in the area. Also if you are not afraid of public transit, my husband and i took the light rail to and from the airport. It is about 2 blocks to the university station from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here every time I visit Seattle”
Reviews.Author: travels4w0rk
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, wonderful staff, perfect hotel. I love the sensitivity to the environment that this chain shows. My personal favorite part is the organic tea in the lobby each morning.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Spot !”
Reviews.Author: DShea_11
Reviews.Content: I love the Alexis hotel, every staff member was friendly and welcoming and my room was very nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. Make sure to have breakfast in the library room, such a nice way to start the day, so yummy. And, it was really nice to receive a wake up call from a real person wishing you a good day. These little touches are what make me want to find a Kimpton when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: guppy320
Reviews.Content: We have been to Seattle before but this was our first time staying at Hotel Alexis. We choose it after having a great experience at Hotel Monaco, another Kimpton Hotel, in Portland, OR in April 2010. We knew what to expect in regards to quality of the hotel and we were not disappointed. What is overall the best attribute to this hotel is its location to major tourist attractions, the water and public transportation. If you're looking to take advantage of all three, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite annual get-away...”
Reviews.Author: zoedarwinbrown
Reviews.Content: As usual, our latest stay at the Alexis was great! We enjoy the location, there are a number of really good restaurants in walking distance and the shopping and activities are relatively easy to get to. The staff were great, no matter what their position in the hotel, they all checked in with us to see how our stay was going. We love relaxing before dinner with their wine tasting. We have found some great new wine discoveries, they often have local wine we hadn't tried before. Being a Kimpton repeat customer, our preferences were all catered to, including the type of pillows and our newspaper preference. We really enjoy the high quality of the art displayed throughout the hotel and our room showcased a local glass blowing artist, Canlis, that included pictures of him and his team blowing glass, an album of his creations amd some of his glass was on display. As well, our teenage daughter enjoys the luxury of the suite we booked. The Alexis is our favourite Seattle get-away, we'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Contemporanious
Reviews.Content: Our last stay at the Alexis confirmed it as our favorite hotel. We have stayed at many hotels in Seattle, New York & abroad. The Alexis has spacious well kept rooms with beautiful contemporary design and artwork. The staff is professional yet relaxed and welcoming. They are pet friendly and truly seem to enjoy having them at the hotel. The rooms and incidentals are very reasonably and competitively priced. It is hard to find a hotel that is contemporary yet still is spacious and elegant. The Alexis scores well on all of the above. More details below: Room was clean and spacious. Heard sounds from the hall but none from other rooms. Room service was quick and friendly. Food was served warm, simple choices but good. Everything worked! No problems with heat. A/C, lamps, water pressure, water temperature, HD TV...etc. An enjoyable and easy stay (i.e. each request was accommodated, and we never had to call the front desk to get something fixed or remind them of something that was forgotten.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and all around experience!”
Reviews.Author: Karlex06
Reviews.Content: Our stay was lovely, from arrival experience to the check out. Room was much larger then we had expected, for a standard king room that we had booked, even I was surprised that while making room reservation on their web site we had 10 different room types or specialty suites to chose from. Room was really clean with elegant design, plenty room space and we were really comfortable in it. Complimentary wine hour was a delight before our dinner, really relaxing. Staff was great, friendly, knowledgeable of the area and willing to answer our questions. Our housekeeper made us dog towel fold on the bed, that was a great surprise! Internet was free once we had joined their loyalty program Kimpton in Touch that comes with other benefits too. All around happy and we will definitely be staying at Alexis any time in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience all around!”
Reviews.Author: Vickik41
Reviews.Content: Did a runaway weekend to Seattle for a "big" birthday, and what a treat it was! Our room was upgraded to a large, elegant room with kitchen, champagne, fresh fruit and birthday wishes, which was a delightful surprise. We arrived by train and loved the location with its easy walking to the waterfront, Pikes market and more. The staff was great at all points of contact. A terrific restaurant and bistro bar. I also was very impressed with their environmental policies and practices. The hotel was a perfect blend of trendy and NW casual. I will definitely make this my hotel of choice in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Very very small room”
Reviews.Author: mjtoal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at various Kimpton hotels in other cities before, so was confident of a good experience, but when I got to my room, I was shocked by how small it was. I have made about 80 transatlantic trips to the US in the past 10 years and stayed at many hotels in this price and class range, and never ever stayed in a room so small. It is also badly designed for the small space. The bed has a metal four poster frame which blocks the already-tight squeeze past, and the chair at the desk at the bottom of the bed hits the bed if moved back. There is nowhere to put a suitcase without creating a trip hazard, and the TV must be observed from the bed or sitting right under it at the desk. There is a chair in the corner of the room, but rather pointlessly so as there is nowhere useful to put it. The room sizes are stated as 300-500 sq feet on the website. Including the bathroom space, I can't see how this room is much more than 230 sq feet and too much of that is taken up by the bathroom. It is somewhat ironic that the hotel sells itself as "pet-friendly" because you couldn't swing a cat in this room. So I asked the front desk, and they told me they were full, sorry, nothing they can do. When I said that I was coming back to Seattle in a few weeks and would not pay $290 for that room again, the receptionist curtly advised I should book a higher room category. Not likely. Different hotel, for sure. Pity really. The hotel seems to have a lot going for it. Nice funky decor, decent food, but the astonishing size of the room and the curt response by the front desk make this a no-go for me.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, relaxing and inviting.”
Reviews.Author: A_Denegar
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Seattle for a Valentine's Day/Birthday gift February 10-13, and we stayed at the Alexis for two nights for the first time.
