My wife was suitably impressed with the room (basic, king), its decor, cleanliness and overall appearance. The room is dark but not depressing. Great interior design. Very comfortable bed and very comfortable pillows. Really, it was a nice place to stay. The front desk staff were welcoming and professional at all times, both at check-in and check-out. The concierge, who was serving complimentary wine when we checked in just after 5 PM, was a great fellow who provided local eating recommendations and just, overall, a great guy. Doorman was very efficient and got us a cab whenever we needed it, and helped us with the luggage. I will be definitely returning to this hotel and will likely get a bigger room. The only thing the room was missing was a coffee pot and coffee, as they often put in other hotels. Also, the two bathrobes (leopard print, yeah!) were "L" but I think they need to go to XL sizes for these things.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: JACBWALLAWALLA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here February 12, 2011 for his 40th birthday. It was our first night of full sleep as we had a baby in October. I have never reviewed a hotel before, but feel inclined as I didn't find any negative reviews on the hotel when checking it out on the web. I was not impressed. The room cost the same as other waterfront hotels, but with a view of a brick building. The cold water didn't work on the bathroom sink; the only thing we requested was a bucket of ice for drinks and after a friendly, "we will bring that right up", it never came; the bed cover had a dark mark looking like a makeup stain or mud stain that I wish had been considered dirty and replaced; the dark curtains didn't cover the windows by design so only the sheers and no ability to get darkness in the room; we were woken up about 9:00 a.m. by maids yelling at each other in Spanish while vacuuming either right out front our door or in a room where the door was open while they were cleaning. We will not waste our money at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms so small I thought I was in NYC”
Reviews.Author: nickit98
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel my main criteria in searching was for something unique, designer, luxury anything outside of the normal chain hotel feeling. The pictures on the website depicted that..however, upon my arrival it was much different than I had anticipated. I am in the design industry, the design of this hotel was done tastefully but lacked anything really unique or memorable. The room had a bad odor, the bed was very hard and not all that comfortable. The pillows were cheap. There is no bathtub. The wall are so thin you can hear every little noise including a weird beeping that kept me up all night. The curtains let in bright light. What hell is with the giant dogs on vacation???? OMG I can see bringing your little chihuahua but a friggin mastif? The lobby was chalk full of giant dogs to the point in which it became comical. One nice thing was the complementary wine during happy hour. The offered a nice selection and if you could get a seat near the bar they offered art supplies and you could color or paint. I was really surprized when I asked the front desk what brand of coffee they serve at breakfast and she had no clue. Hello this is Seattle! I mean isn't coffee a big deal here? In closing if you love giant dogs, microscopically small rooms, hard beds, noise at all hours, lackluster design then this will be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, the BEST breakfast”
Reviews.Author: goldilachs
Reviews.Content: We were overall very pleased with our three night stay at the Hotel Alexis. The front desk service was pleasant and extremely helpful. The hotel restaurant, the Library Bistro, is a delightful restaurant in its own right. My boyfriend and I enjoyed breakfasts in their cozy booths among the bookshelves. Tina, our waitress at breakfast, went out of her way to suggest some fantastic places to dine and have a drink in Seattle and even wrote down a list for us. We followed her recommendations and were not disappointed. As for the rooms, we had a deluxe king which ended up being quite spacious. One corner of the room had a chair where a couch would have been more comfortable and appropriate. The bathrooms are very cute and retain historic charm with their large sinks and counters and black and white tiled floors. Although we thought the room to be a tad overpriced, we found the hotel to be a good value for Seattle and were very pleased with the experience. One note for those bringing cars: There is loads of street and garage parking at much cheaper rates than the valet offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: rlivings7878
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to celebrate his 30th birthday...champagne and grapes awaited him on arrival along with birthday card...staff was amazing and took care of our every need day and night...location great within walking distance of everything...we stayed in fireplace suite which was perfect for our January stay...can't wait to stay here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly spot away from home!”
Reviews.Author: PartnersUs
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Alexis... sadly short, just an overnight, without much opportunity to maximize the facilities. Still, the staff -- from doorman to desk clerks -- always had a smile for me and an offer for help. On a previous stay I had a delightul, light meal and a glass of wine in the adjacent Library. My room was pleasant and comfortable, amenities were nice, all was quiet. I highly recommend this gem of a spot!

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kevpar5
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Alexis Hotel was great. From the minute I walked in everyone was very friendly, the place was very clean and nicely decorated. The room was great with a wonderful view. The best part of the experience was that they allowed pets. I have two large dogs and they were welcome as much as I was. The hotel even offers pet care. They offer to come to your room and take your dogs for a walk. Tremendous deal if you plan to be out on the town for a long period of time. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: MNSinDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Alexis in December. Staff is very friendly. Hotel is nice, though starting to look a little tired around the edges. The room was comfortable, though a bit dark. Had some trouble getting the TV to work. We were reasonably happy until 3:30 am when a VERY loud trash truck pulled up right below our window and began emptying multiple dumpster bins. It was there for about 30 minutes. Soon after, other loud trucks began lumbering up the hill outside our window. The front desk staff in the morning asked how our night was. I started to tell her that we were awoken at 3:30 am -- before I even finished my sentence, she said, "the trash truck? Yeah, we've been having a problem with that." Then, why does the hotel continue to put people in the room RIGHT above their trash? We checked out and moved across the street to the Hotel 1000, where we enjoyed 4 blissful nights of quiet luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jarcyp
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle twice a year on business and usually stay at the Westin. I tried this hotel on a recommendation from a friend and was not dissappointed. The room was very large and well appointed. The location was great too as it is located closer to the water so no long uphill walks. Great bar too with a good atmosphere, great selection, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: fannyflipsta
Reviews.Content: We took the light rail from the airport to just above the Alexis, arriving @10:00am. They had no problem with an early check in. Our suite was spectacular. We've stayed all over the world and it has to be one of the most beautiful rooms ever. Seattle was so romantic, I called it the Paris of the northwest. The city was dressed up for the holidays and everyone was feeling in the spirit. The deal we had came with breakfast and it was just wonderful, try the strawberry jam(yum). The museum is a few blocks up the street, the Pikes Market also just a few blocks. If this review is gushing it's my love letter to all the Seattlites who made it so great!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bstone236928mi
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on AmTrak from Chicago to Seattle where we spent two nights before leaving for LA again on AmTrak. We got to the Alexis hotel about noon and were upgraded to a fantastic suite over the room we had reserved. The room was beautiful and had a wonderful view of Puget Sound. The wireless internet (included, not extra cost) worked flawlessly. The suite was equipped with two large flat panel TVs and a mini bar with refrigerator. The "computer desk" was great as well as the high back swivel chair in front of it. We would have liked to stay longer but were on a schedule with AmTrak. Everyone at the hotel made sure that everything was perfect. The stay could not have been better. The Alexis Hotel will be on our list (short) of places to stay in Seattle for a long time to come. The furniture and the bed were extremely comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Treasure in City Center ~ close to Pike Market and SOM”
Reviews.Author: CanadaKids
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Alexis a total of 4 times over the last 2 years and we love it. It is a charming, modern hotel close to everything downtown. We enjoy the hotel for generous sized rooms and we always book a room with a fireplace. The hotel is pet friendly - so we appreciate being able to bring our mini-daschunds with us. The staff are outstanding and are very friendly. I will continue to stay at this hotel whenever we travel to Seattle. The parking is a bit expensive - so leave your car at home. BUt no more expensive than any other pay parking lot. We sometimes take the train from BC to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: The_Style_Guy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the three pet-friendly Kimpton hotels in Seattle. The others are the Monaco and the Hotel Vintage Park. All three are nice and they all have an afternoon wine tasting. Anyway, back to the Alexis. The service was excellent and the room decor--like the Monaco--was a little eclectic and a nice change from the normal corporate closet. We had our little dog with us, and they had a welcome sign in front of her hotel with her name on it. We were pleasantly surprised to find food and water bowls and a dog bed when we got to the room. It's a perfect location and is close to the ferries and the market. I'm not sure how to rate the price, since that is very subjective. For the deluxe king room I paid $170, which I thought was cheap. I would highly recommend this hotel and I plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Suite was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rainpatter
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights and had a perfect stay. Booked the spa suite and room was clean, bed was comfortable, and bathroom was huge. I enjoyed the eclectic lamps and sculptures. As an Kimpton member received $10 mini bar credit and free wifi. Hot cocoa hour at 2-430, and morning coffee/tea. New York Times delivered to the door. Housekeeping completely respected the Do Not Disturb sign and didn't try once to interrupt our late lie in. Employees were extremely friendly and helpful. Did you know that they have bikes that they let you use? Probably not, since the valets/bellhops told us that we were only the second people to use them since they came in. So make sure to inquire, fantastic bike path along the waterfront two blocks away. Tub was appropriately huge and they provided bath salts and full size bath sheets, and were happy to bring us extra towels each day per our note. Location perfect. Did a happy hour at Boka across the street (where everything was good, especially the lamb sausage). Had excellent service at the Bookstore Bar, where they happily accepted our six drink vouchers (part of their cocktail package) and were very attentive. Also had brunch at the Library Bistro, and the food was also outstanding. Had the mushroom benedict, with savory bread pudding. Rich and worth it. About a five to ten mintue walk from Pike Place Market. (As a side note, had a very good experience at the Comedy Underground club in Pioneer Square). Negative: Would have appreciated a music system in the incredible bathroom. Also, better quality toilet paper. No complimentary mouthwash. Side note, my friend stayed at the honeymoon suite, which was identical to mine, but I'm told the honeymoon suite has a skylight and canopied bed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Seattle Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sparky916
Reviews.Content: We chose the Alexis for out second annual Seattle getaway and couldn't have chosen better. The previous year we stayed at a more expensive name brand hotel but the location, decor, and service of the Alexis made our experience this year unforgettable. It didn't hurt that the Milagros Spa and the Bookstore bar were both in the hotel and offered amazing service. We WILL be back next year. I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “A Delight”
Reviews.Author: rfriedman70
Reviews.Content: Large, well decorated, brightly lit rooms with comfortable furniture. Service was flawless. We stay in Kimptom Hotels whenever we can because they are priced at the upper end of moderate and you get a luxury experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant to book a boutique hotel that I'd never heard of, but the pictures on their website were so tempting that I gave it a shot. I am so so glad I booked my stay at this hotel. I absolutely loved the contemporary classic decor as this is how I'd want to design my home! The staff were always friendly and helpful from the time I stepped out of the cab, to check in, to housekeeping. I had originally booked the Queen Queen room, but thought I'd let my two friends have it, while I took the king bed room. My room was immaculate...super clean with bathroom fixtures which looked like they were hand polished every day! Best of all was the super soft and comfortable bed and sheets! I slept like a baby. Then, when my friends arrived, checked in, and opened the door to their Queen Queen room in the next tower, my jaw dropped and my friends were screaming silly at just how huge and gorgeous the room was!!!....did I mention that it was huge?.....Huge with high celings!....and beautifully decorated too! I was jealous, but my room was really nice too and located at the 4 storey front tower. The only thing you don't get at this hotel are views as they all face right into the buildings on all sides. And the only other complaint from my friends were the guests staying above them stomping on the floors for 3-4 straight hours early in the morning which I'm told was really annoying. They have a small gym with a few nice pieces of equipment. I didn't get the chance to use the gym as I already got plenty of exercise walking around town for a few hours each day. The hotel is located at a very convenient location downtown. Close enough to the shopping area and Pike's Place Public Market just 3-4 short blocks away. Plenty of excellent restaurants nearby too. The hotel has a dining bistro called the Library Bistro which only serves breakfast and brunch. They have excellent breakfasts here! In this same bistro they held free wine tasting sessions during happy hour. I'm not sure if this is a temporary or regular do for their guests, but it was great! When you think of wine tasting you think perhaps you get a sip worth's of wine in a glass, but no, you get a whole glass!!! At the front of the hotel there's a nice cozy little bar where you can also order food from the bistro till about 10pm. Nice little place to gather with your friends for drinks. Sometimes it was really packed and sometimes it was empty. The waitress we had was really nice and friendly and came to chat with us a lot...during the times it was empty. My only other real complaint was that it costs $36 per day for hotel guests to valet park here....seems a bit expensive for guests. I highly and totally recommend this hotel for any kind of stay, and will definitely stay here the next time I visit Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly nice & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LizOmaha_NE
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the spa suites and the bathroom was almost as big as my apartment so that was incredibly nice. The hotel was generally quiet and well located. We really like the free downtown bus with stops within a block or 2 of the hotel. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly with good suggestions for restaurants. One drawback is the price for valet - $36 a night, but good luck finding anything cheaper in the area to park overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a friendly city!”
Reviews.Author: Mrmacken
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel for our girls trip, ages 36-38. We had the HUGE king room with a dining table and chairs--great for wine and cheese before dinner. Animal print robes were a nice touch. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, especially John at the door. He recommended 2 lively restaurants with great food near the hotel: Wild Ginger and Purple. Pike Place market and lots of shopping nearby. I had an AMAZING facial by Krista at the Aveda spa downstairs. Would recommend this place in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerryjacobs7
Reviews.Content: We were in Seattle for a wedding at the Alexis. It was our first time in Seattle so we wanted to see as much of the city as we could. The Alexis was in the perfect location! We walked to many locations. We didn't need to use a car at all. We did use some public transportation which was easily accessable from the Alexis. It was the perfect spot for a great vacation. It was so nice to get back to the hotel tired and enjoy a glass of wine at the hotels happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location, Fantastic restaurant - what more could I ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Wuah
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location for this hotel. Easy walks to PIke's Market, Pioneer Square and the stadiums. Lots of terrific shopping, dining and nightlife right near hotel....but I don't even know if you would even need to leave. The staff at the hotel was great all the way around, from the front desk to the staff at the Library Bistro (restaurant - reviewed separately). The room was great - immaculate, spacious and very nicely decorated. (I actually stayed in one of the suites, and it was exceptionally roomy, even for a suite, and really liked the lay out.) And the price was quite reasonable to boot. Don't miss out on the Bistro restaurant. Small and cute, but had a terrific meal there. All in all, my favorite place in Seattle and I've tried quite a few. I'd stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff were very friendly and made sure we were happy.”
Reviews.Author: mc495
Reviews.Content: I am a picky traveler and I must say that staying at the Alexis was PERFECT. The staff was so nice and friendly and HELPFUL. Staying at a small boutique hotel is the way to go. Coffee & tea was served in the lobby and wine in the afternoon. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and once again, I eat out alot, and this was one of the best breakfasts I've had. The ambience is just right.

Reviews.Title: “A very Inviting Place”
Reviews.Author: nanita30
Reviews.Content: We chose the Alexis because of our experience with other Kimpton Hotels and we were right in doing so. It was relatively small (120 rooms) with an elegant lobby and a friendly and informative staff. The rooms were sophisticated in color and design, fairly large and very clean. We slept soundly in a comfortable bed. Complimentary coffee and newspapers were available in the lobby each morning. The hotel's location was excellent. You could walk to many places - Pioneer Square, The Seattle Art Museum, Pike Place Market, and the waterfront. First Avenue had wonderful boutiques, shops and restaurants. We will stay here again when we get back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: pickytravelcritic
Reviews.Content: I tend to be very picky when it come to hotels and this hotel exceeded my expectations. Loved the room decor and cleaniness, which are the most important to me. The only downside is the location, which is desolate at night.

Reviews.Title: “Upbeat and downtown”
Reviews.Author: SmokedmeatVancouver
Reviews.Content: If you're doing downtown Seattle this is a great place to stay. Took Kind suite and loved bedding, quiet at night and size of rrom. Shower and bathroom very spa like. Nice touches included newspaper free internet and yoga mat. Reviews here point out parking cost is high so I parked two blocks away down 1t for $18 a night - about half the cost. Also loved the $1 more free breakfast or wine option. Good value. Also the service is very warm and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Fall Weekend, Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: MASKK
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a number of times at this property and had another good experience in October. Wine hour was great as usual, the Concierge arranged Picasso tickets for us, and the room was large and quiet (we were upgraded). Easy walk to dining and the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel - Seattle”
Reviews.Author: LakeHavasu7109
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this property and fell in love w/it. Location, location, location -- near to Pike Place Mkt, fabulous restaurants and shopping w/in walking distance. Staff was very attentive as well as friendly -- one had the feeling that they enjoyed their jobs. Rooms have alot of charm and very comfortable. We could not have been happier and will stay here in the future

Reviews.Title: “Beware...they charge $36 a day for parking”
Reviews.Author: Tatitr
Reviews.Content: My daughter purchased a one-week trip to Seattle for me as a birthday present. It was purchased through Orbitz. and one of the amenities listed was "parking". The day after we arrived and checked in, I said to her are you sure parking is included in the package? She said I'm sure, but I'll double check at the desk. They told her it was $36 a day so tack onto your bill a $250 tab for parking for a week! The other thing is the bathroom set up is not user friendly. The tub is the most uncomfortable bathtub I've ever used. The sink has no countertop at all so there is no place toiletries, makeup, toothbrushes, etc.. There is a separate cupboard on wall behind you with very little room for your own stuff. It's a really bad set up. On the bright note, the beds were the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel. I slept really well, (once I got over the shock of the parking tab!). And it was very quiet which was surprising since it is in the heart of Seattle. It is an upscale hotel, guests a little snobbish, so if you want the very friendly, fun type of place this is not it. I would recommend it if you don't want a hotel to hang out in. The restaurant is very expensive. There are great ones all around. We did not go to it.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: p_thurman
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I was in Seattle for business and the Alexis Hotel was one block away from work. The hotel itself was absolutely beautiful and when I checked in, I first got a room next to the street, which was quite noisy. I went downstairs and explained to the person at the desk that I was there for a whole week, for business, and they relocated me to a quite room towards the back of the building. I loved it. The staff was friendly, my rate included a very simple and tasty breakfast, and the rooms were beautiful. You can't beat the location (just a few blocks from the Market). I would definitely stay here again. It's a bit pricey but worth it for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quite a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ALRG
Reviews.Content: I chose the Alexis because of its location but found that the service, room quality, features and overall niceness were much better than expected. The only downside was an extremely high charge for parking, which netted $40 per day after taxes. Otherwise, the room and all amenities were all better than expected and a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Spot in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jki_travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the Alexis after our 10 day adventure around the Pacific Northwest. This hotel is in a great location -- close to the waterfront and Pike Place market, and a quick 15 minute drive to the airport. Loved the artsy decor of the hotel and the great customer service. My only complaint is that when your neighbor flushes their toilet it sounded like it was in our room, and when the A/C kicks on it was quite noisy. Even though I wasn't traveling with a dog, I loved how pet friendly the hotel was! Very fun!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jafware
Reviews.Content: Second time I've stayed at this hotel. Both times have been very enjoyable. Quite room, even though it had a fun view over 1st Avenue. This hotel is in a perfect location. Close to everything downtown. If you happen to be going to a show at the Showbox at the Market, it's perfect! Also, the bar is the best Whiskey bar in town. The happy hour is excellent as well. Happy Hour even on Saturday and Sunday! Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alexis and the Bookstore Bar”
Reviews.Author: photochic23
Reviews.Content: With the assistance of the reviews on Tripadvisor, we decided to give the Alexis a try and we couldn't have been happier with our decision. The hotel felt like home and the staff was so nice and helpful. The coffee in the lobby in the morning was a wonderful surprise. The only thing we never figured out was when the wine hour was...no one ever told us and we never asked. I had seen other reviewers comment on the wine hour, so we knew that the hotel offered it. We booked the King Suite and for the two of us it was plenty of room. The bed was cozy and the bathroom was spacious. We also found that the "HAPPY HOUR" in the Bookstore Bar was awesome and well worth dropping in to partake in the delights!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, a home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaP5555
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step in, the staff of the Alexis, welcome you to the hotel. They check you in quickly and you can get settled into your room in no time. I was there for 5 days and I was always excited to get back to my room. I hope to have more time to relax in there on my next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “real winner”
Reviews.Author: drwho304
Reviews.Content: As always the Kimpton Alexis Hotel exceeded our expectations. This is a truly wonderful hotel in the exceptional Kimpton style. Situated in a perfect location to explore the best Seattle has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable and very good customer service”
Reviews.Author: checkercab
Reviews.Content: My quick trip to Seattle was made quite comfortable by the Alexis Hotel staff -- from parking service to the room -- it was a very easy and warm experience. Keep up the good work. Generally the Kimpton Hotels (this is one of them) are terrific places to stay and treat their guests quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: WarrenDSM
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is what a hotel in the urban center of a great city should be. It is located in the heart of it all, providing a quiet retreat from the 24/7 "buzz" outside its door. Staff was most helpful and congenial, my room was spotless and everything worked! - including the wireless internet connection. I wish every city had a boutique hotel of the Alexis' calibre and ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: WildlifeFan89
Reviews.Content: My college-age son and I visited Seattle, where we lived for 13 years, before we moved East three years ago. It was a trip to visit our old favorite places. Since it was the weekend of the annual Bumbershoot music festival and Labor Day weekend as well, hotel rooms were extremely scarce, and I had planned the trip only a couple of weeks beforehand. The Alexis was one of the only hotels that offered a separate bed for my son with enough room to get around, at a reasonable (less than $300 per night) price for that time period. We ended up in an "Executive suite", which has a living room, fully separate bedroom, and dining/conference area. We put a rollaway bed in the living room (it supposedly had a sofabed, but did not, a glitch.) The arrangement was extremely comfortable for our four-night stay. The staff was friendly. There was coffee and tea in the lobby in the AM, and, for a change from most hotels, plenty of copies of the NY Times, Seattle Times, and Wall St Journal -- there were usually some left to take even in the afternoon! There was a guest PC with internet access at the front desk so you can print out boarding passes and quickly check email or find info online. The only real glitch was that the shower head did not work -- I took baths -- but there was plenty of hot water and high water pressure. (To be fair, I did not notify anyone about the shower head.) I had requested a room on a higher floor, but all they turned out to have was one on the second floor, so they took about ten percent off my nightly hotel rate. Great location -- walking distance to Pike Place Market, the waterfront, Elliott Bay Books in Pioneer Square and the good restaurants in Belltown. We even walked to Seattle Center, although that is about a half-hour walk even at a fast pace. You could also walk to the International District. Parking is a bit pricey - $36 per night for overnight guests - but the valet service was friendly and very efficient. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, excellent staff, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Karen52024
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Alexis a couple of times. We love it! The bed and sheets are very comfortable. Furnishings are stylish. The location is excellent for exploring downtown. The staff are pleasant and attentive, yet not overbearing. They seem to like their jobs. We will return as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: NYC200999
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nicely decorated/very clean, the staff was extremely friendly, the location was perfect. it is an older building, so you can hear your neighbors every now and again, but it wasn't too bad and definitely worth the location, decor, and price. i would stay definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The prettiest hotel, rooms wonderful and staff WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: karen_brackeen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just beautiful. The staff was wonderful. I have nothing negative to say about my stay at the Alexis, except I wish it could have been longer.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: debbielyn
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at nearly all of the major hotels in downtown Seattle I was thrilled to come upon the Alexis. It has many of the unique and quirky touches of a Kimpton Hotel and more. The hotel itself has a comfortable (yet professional) feel from the moment one enters the lobby. Rooms are all different but beautifully appointed and spacious The staff is first rate, and everyone I encountered went out of their way to be helpful. Food at both restaurants is outstanding and worth a trip even if you are not a hotel guest. And if you travel with a pet I cannot imagine a nicer experience. Front desk staff volunteered to babysit my lab last year while I ran quick errands! The neighborhood is so interesting, a welcome relief from the big chains and convention center area. Yet there is so much within easy walking distance (including Pike's Market, museums, dining and great shopping). A great way to experience Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend hotel prior to Alaskan cruise”
Reviews.Author: MsKK
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent staff, elegant decor, wine "happy-hour," comfy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely friendly and pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: MrCuddles
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great; one night in a spa room with so-so view and great spacious room, then 2 nights in a great King Deluxe (Rm 645?) with unobstructed view of Puget Sound and Olympics from bed and a full view of Mt Rainier and the ballfields from bathroom window. We brought our dog and she loved hotel (nothing repellent in the rooms or halls as has happened on other trips), dogs in hotel completely improve the atmosphere in the lobby for guests, and they watched her behind the front desk for a couple hours when we went to dinner. Appears the employees self-select themselves (dog lovers) to work there as they were all obviously dog lovers. Parking is a problem downtown and hotel valet parking ($36/night) is painful. If you stay in Spa Room, do bring your own spa products for tub (not provided). Hotel sent me an email survey after the stay, which I filled out and sent back via email. The hotel GM contacted me the next day to follow-up which was a nice touch to our stay and a sign of their customer focus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, hip property.”
Reviews.Author: MLD2000
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, with very nice, spacious suites. I stayed in a corner Premier Suite, which was probably about 750 sq. ft., with lots of natural light and an equal amout of character. Loved the use of hip designs, colors, materials, and textures in the renovation of this historic building - the result is the perfect mix of modern and retro. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: AquinasWI
Reviews.Content: We came to Seattle for a wedding, and stayed at the Alexis for 5 nights. First off, from the minute we stepped in until the very end, every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. The room was excellent, with one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in in any hotel. Location is great -- it's a couple blocks from Pioneer Square, Pike Place Market, the waterfront....pretty much all the highlights of downtown Seattle. We went everywhere on foot, having no need for a car. There is a one-hour complimentary wine bar every night, as well as complimentary coffee in the morning and iced tea/lemonade the afternoon. We did not try room service, but did have a very good breakfast in the Library Bistro. All around, it was a wonderful experience and would be my top choice again the next time we head to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “All around perfect place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: joeypal
Reviews.Content: The Alexis, in keeping with all of the Kimpton brand's properties, had a unique and eclectic vibe to it -- from the art to the furniture selected, you can tell that there was a great attention to detail in the hotel's design. Our room featured a separate sitting area that looked more like a living room in a modern loft than a hotel room. As we were on a road trip, we appreciated feeling "at home" while we were at a hotel. Room service food quality - even at midnight - was excellent, mini-bar selection was unique and plentiful (as always), the hotel and room was perfectly clean. Location on First Ave. - just five blocks from Pike Place Market - was a plus. Highly recommended -- just beware of the $36/night parking fee -- that is, unless you drive a hybrid, which gets you a 50% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: timh_10
Reviews.Content: My train arrived 2 hours late. Hotel staff was gracious and I was upgraded to an even nicer roon (they are all beautiful to begin with) and given a gift certificate for the honor bar. My trip didn't start off on the best note, but the staff and theaccommodations at the Alexis made sure that it the trip was enjoyable. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Seattle spot!”
Reviews.Author: TammyW58
Reviews.Content: We were headed to Seattle for a Mariners game and a fun weekend. This is the 2nd time we've stayed at the Alexis and it was wonderful. We were upgraded to a premium suite, which was amazing! My husband could sleep in while I read and stretched in a separate sitting room with sofa and tv. The staff was really helpful and friendly, they had recommendations where needed, they even gave us coupons for free drinks at the local Irish pub. We've been to Seattle a number of times, but the Alexis is the reason we decided to go for 2 nights instead of making it a quick trip up from Portland and back. We have definitely found our favorite spot in Seattle - we could walk to the game and Pike St Market and the waterfront. The location is perfect. They even allow you to bring your dog! The room was quiet and perfect! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot think of a better place to stay in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: Iluvshoes0410
Reviews.Content: What is important when choosing a hotel--a good night's sleep. That means a comfortable bed, cleanliness, and a relaxing atmosphere. The Alexis has all of this plus a great decor, large rooms with sitting area and courteous, efficient staff. The bathroom was not only sparkling clean, but the elegant fixtures, the marble floor, and the great towels added to a comfortable stay. This is a small hotel with a cozy lobby and friendly staff. All our requests were met with a smile and a quick response. The location is handy not only for restaurants and downtown shopping and the waterfornt, but for events at Quest Field or Safeco Fields. I have stayed here before and I will stay here again. It will always be my choice of hotels when I have the opportunity to visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: MtnDog69
Reviews.Content: The Alexis Hotel is a quality hotel much like all of the other hotels in the Kimpton portfolio. High quality with great service and unique decor. I would highly recommend joining Kimpton Intouch prior to staying at the hotel to take advantage of the program benefits (free high speed internet, room personalization, and other valuable freebies). We have stayed at many other hotels in Seattle, but always return to the Alexis because it is a great value. I also recommend the happy hour menu and drink specials in the hotel bar because they are probably the best in the area. I am not too thrilled about the $36 a night parking, but it matches the rates charged by other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location downtown - close to Pike St. Market & museums”
Reviews.Author: CanadaKids
Reviews.Content: My family and I and are our 2 dachsunds spent a fabulous weekend at the Alexis while we were in Seattle for the Rock and Roll Marathon. We have stayed twice at the Alexis and it is our favorite Seattle hotel as it is walking distance from the market, shopping and the museums. We are also thrilled that this a pet friendly hotel. The staff is amazing - very friendly and helpful. We plan to stay again when we return for the Seattle Marathon in Nov.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Hour!!!! Turndown Service! Nice People!”
Reviews.Author: BayouGuy4036
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. We had a Spa room on the 6th floor so we were away from 1st Street hustle and bustle and also had a nice view of Elloit Bay. I've never stayed in a Kimpton hotel before but I will be checking for them across the country from now on when I travel. From 5-6 every day was wine hour. Basically they had 2-3 local wines that they would serve up to all the guest that would attend and it was unlimited wine and the best part of it all is IT WAS ALL FREE! Haha! My wife and I took advantage of this and enjoyed wine for 5 days at the Kimpton. Also, the rooms were very roomy. This hotel you can tell was a little older but was kept up very nice. Our room had a sofa, a dining table along with a king size bed. The bathroom was huge with a walk in shower and the two person spa tub. The location of the hotel was very good. Set on first street we were in walking distance to just about everywhere downtown Seattle. Pioneer Square, Safeco, Pikes Market, Ruth Chris ;) Last but not least the staff went out of their way to make us feel at home while we were there. Everynight the radio was on in our room and the sheets turndowned. Very attenative. All in all I would stay here again. I give it a 10/10, and 5 stars. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishkona
Reviews.Content: Loved the personality in the room and all the amenities. Excellent location for a walk to great downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “BIG room with a Fabulous location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: hbletch
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at a Kimpton Hotel. And boy, are we hooked! The mattresses and pillows are divine and we sleep so well. The Alexis has an amazing location to all the fun Seattle sights. We were just blocks from Pikes Place and the waterfront, an easy walk to the monorail and the Space Needle - it was perfect. The bellman noticed that we didnt' have enough pillows for our family of four, so he ran to get another and was back in less than 5 minutes! We joined the In-Touch program at Kimpton and received our choice of $10 worth of items from the well-stocked mini-bar. When we arrived, there were complimentary Arnold Palmers in the lobby (tea and lemonade) and shortly thereafter, they had a complimentary winetasting hour... On top of all this, our corner room was HUGE! We had a 1 bedroom unit that was like an apartment. And it even boasted a partial water view! (oh, the ONLY drawback, was the $35 parking fee for our rental car... wish that was a little less steep) When we visit Seattle again, you can bet we'll be at the Alexis!

Reviews.Title: “Far and above the rest!”
Reviews.Author: WingsAirways
Reviews.Content: I began my love affair with Kimpton Hotels 3 years ago with the Hotel Monaco in Portland. I have since traveled to both Kimptons in Portland and all 3 in Seattle. This crazy rushed world simply slows down to a friendly, welcoming pace once you walk through the front door. The style, elegance, comfort, and customer service prove that traveling can be a five start experience! I recently filled out an online comment form and mentioned a very minor detail...and within a day I had an unexpected personal response with an instant remedy for my concern. It is personal touches like that that make me a loyal follower! Our Springer Spaniel, Maggie Clementine, travels with us about half of our visits and the pet friendly atmosphere is priceless! Our whole family will always recommend Kimpton Hotels! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lex85
Reviews.Content: The Alexis Hotel in downtown Seattle is absolutely the most wonderful experience I have ever had in a hotel. I would compare it to Ihiliani in Hawaii. The staff was wonderful, anything I could ever possibly need was taken care of for us. The room was beautiful and beyond my expectations. Thanks for a wonderful stay and we will be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Been there once... and not likely again.”
Reviews.Author: Camillabudda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful online. I was very impressed by the lobby, and area leading up to the room. Once in the room, noticed how dusty it was. First thing that I did was pull back the curtains and saw dust everywhere...hmmm. Hotel room was huge! Furniture and art were great. Very close to Pike place market (couple blocks away). Then you can also walk to the city center on 6th street and Pike where all the shops are (Sephora, H&M, Cheesecake Factory, etc.). Got back late from a show (Russell Peters) and wanted to find a quick place to eat, but there was nothing open. Apparently, the only places open were a 10 minute ride away. That was very inconvenient, and the concierge didn't know what was around or what was even open. Not very good service. Then the next morning, I asked what the temp was for the day, put me on hold for 5 mins so that they could check. Again, not so prepared. Won't stay there again. No night life, would rather stay around somewhere on 6th and up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: CJGBFD
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It's within walking distance of everything! Our room was magnificent -- very large. And the bathroom was amazing! The tub area was massive, as was the tub itself. The staff was professional, efficient and very pleasant. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location- the jewel in the Kimpton crown”
Reviews.Author: kbardsley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real treat. I like the style of Kimpton hotels anyway and since this had recently been renovated I was eager to check it out. This was my treat to my sister and her husband who wanted to visit Seattle as a possible retirement location. We wanted a hotel that would reflect the unique character of Seattle. The Alexis is perfectly located for walking Seattle, close to a variety of restaurants and sights. I expect a certain “cool factor” from the Kimpton and the Alexis does not disappoint. The themeing around “the library” got major cool points for the variety of books and the neighborhood hang out vibe- the burger was outstanding. The rooms are beautifully decorated and really comfortable. The lobby and meeting rooms are gorgeous! Most importantly the staff is universally excellent. Leadership at this hotel deserves major kudos for selection and training of the staff. Everyone (from bell staff greeting to the maintenance guy who stopped to chat with us about Seattle and the hotel) was consistently friendly, went out of their way to solicit our needs and satisfaction and had the “wow!” factor that made our stay memorable. This is not an inexpensive hotel but it is worth it for the Seattle experience. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Lisa12345678910
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hotel that I have ever stayed in. My husband and I arrived in Seattle by train at 11:30 in the morning. We went to our hotel, hoping that they would hold our bags for us until check in. When we got to the desk, we were told that our room was ready and we could go up now!! (Check out isn't even until noon!!) The room was beautiful, the mini bar stocked, and the bathroom was spotless. The hotel staff was helpful, and uber-friendly, the bookstore bar was so cute and the Library Bistro was tasty and reasonably priced. I don't think that I can ever go back to a non-Kimpton hotel ever again. Look them up and join their rewards club for free wireless internet when you stay there. :) enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: road_warrior_60610
Reviews.Content: The suite was enormous, the view was super, the staff friendly, and the price was surprisingly reasonable. The location is excellent, Pike Stree Market is just a few blocks one way and Pioneer Square a few blocks the other way. The stadiums are just a little further beyond Pioneer Square. The waterfront and water taxi are close by too. The concierge was particularly helpful. As always, the Kimpton bed was so comfortable. When I travel to Seattle for business, Alexis is the first place I call.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price!”
Reviews.Author: Tar Heel Bill 92
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle for business for 2 nights in January 2010 and booked a room at the Alexis, largely due to the great reviews here on tripadvisor.com. The reviews were accurate--this is a great hotel with a fantastic location and all for a very reasonable price. I paid only $129 a night for my 2 nights in a very spacious corner king room. Very stylish, huge windows (with not much view but then I didn't care), lots of light, and a relatively small bathroom. Service was great and friendly. Air conditioning was just OK, but that's a particular issue I have that most do not. For January, I just opened the windows and it cooled down very quickly. I had room service a few times for dinner and breakfast and found the food good and not badly priced. All in all, I would easily recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again for my next visit. Nice job!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgpier95
Reviews.Content: I was referred to stay at the Alexis Hotel by a colleague. I was only going to be there for 3 nights and I needed somewhere close to where I would be working at. The Alexis is right across the street form the office building. I really appreciated the hotel staff who were more than willing to help me with anything I needed and always with a smile. The rooms were kept very clean and it's in a fairly good location. The only thing bad I could say about it is that it is an older hotel, but they have upgraded it and it looks fairly modern. It's just a 4 block walk from Pike Place Market and the first Starbucks store. I would most likely stay here again when I return to town.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: justmoi012
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hote! The location was perfect, lots of things to see and do within walking distance.I stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was beautiful! Loved the blend of the character of the old beautifully restored building and the chic modern decor, the artwork throughout the hotel and in the room was awesome.All the staff were very warm and friendly and make you feel very welcome. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and will definately stay there again next time I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: blockthree
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Helpful and friendly. Made us feel special. Enjoyed the common area and room decors. The artwork was fascinating. Also, there was a feeling of intimacy about the hotel. Enjoyed the Library Bar. The location is between Pike Market and Pioneer Square. Easy walk up or down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: adguy34
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several of the Kimpton properties and this one rated near the top. I'd highly recommend it for both business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: packrat72
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Alexis after returning from an Alaskan Cruise. It was convenient to Pioneer Square and Pike's Place Market. Great staff helped us get where we wanted to go either by car service or directions. Most every place was within walking distance. The room was elegant and very well priced. Wil definitely stay with the Alexis again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from the time I walked in until my departure.”
Reviews.Author: grresq
Reviews.Content: I would take advantage of the courteous and helpful staff and simply ask for what you want. I enjoyed my small but elegant room. It suited me. Some of my colleagues asked for and were upgraded to suites or larger quarters. A cab in the wee hours to the airport? They had a town car waiting for me for less than the cost of the airport cab I took in. My room rate included (to my surprise) a free continental breakfast in the attractive dining room. The croissant and coffee were as good as any I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleJoanne
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, excellent location right downtown about 10 minutes from Pike Street Market. The check in staff & bell boys were knowledgable and friendly without being over the top. The Bookstore Bar had a great atmosphere with good food and great selection of wines & beers. I did not eat in the main hotel Bistro but it looked cosy and had a great atmosphere as well. There are lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance as well. The room was large, I got upgraded due to being a Kimpton Intouch Member. It was on the main street and the noise was minimal. Internet was super fast both in the room and Bookstore Bar. I did not go to the gym, it was small but had plenty of equipment. For the Spa lovers, the Aveda Spa was located right next to the hotel with an entrance directly from the hotel lobby. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: ChesterLeStreet
Reviews.Content: We took the Amtrak from Vancouver to Seattle, which was a nice way to travel. The only downside is the time it takes. Glaciers move faster. There are currently only two trains per day at 6.45am and again at 6.45pm. Ideally, plan to take the early train as the views are lovely. Arrived at 11.20pm on a Saturday night, so got a cab to the Alexis. The hotel was still busy and the Library bar at the front had a really nice atmosphere. (Half-price food and drink during Happy Hour). Our room, the Authors' suite was fantastic. It was vast with separate bedroom and sitting area with chairs and sofa; a dining table and open fire, with easy-to-light logs provided. I've lived in smaller flats. Decor is contemporary without being too minimal and staff are all very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal, being equidistant between Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square. Both are really interesting, but attract quite a number of homeless people, which are not a problem during the day, but might be intimidating at night for some visitors. The monorail to the Space Needle is also a short walk away and a visit is a must for any Sci-Fi or music geek, housing two fascinating museums at the base in a Frank Ghery designed building. Seattle is well worth a visit and has some excellent restaurants and museums, combined with a laid-back atmosphere. The Alexis is probably the best all-rounder, offering style and elegance with superb service and an unbeatable central location

Reviews.Title: “Mostly pleasant experience with a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: BijouK
Reviews.Content: First, the good: The Alexis is in a great location, and the staff seemed really friendly and eager to help. Our room was gorgeous, with a view out to the water. It was a weekend and we managed to save $38 or whatever by parking on the street. The bar was lovely -- really cozy, had magazines and board games -- and the bartender was very friendly and helpful. If we were locals, we'd probably be in there every weekend. When we had plumbing issues, the engineer was at our door in a flash, and he was really friendly. The not-so-good: Our bathroom had some issues. The sink stopper was jammed almost all the way down, so it took a really long time to drain, which I was willing to overlook until I realized that our toilet was clogged. Which made me wonder -- how did the person who cleaned the room after the last guest not notice that the toilet was clogged? Did he/she actually clean the toilet? So then I had cleanliness concerns, which made me stick with showers and skip the long bath I'd planned. And one of the bed pillows had an unpleasant sour smell to it, so I had to toss that on the floor. No way was I putting my head near it. I think they were pretty busy but it took three tries to get a dog bed brought up and it turned out they'd run out. Which is fine, it happens, but if they'd just told us that, we wouldn't have kept trying. (In the end, another dog bed turned up, so I guess the third time's the charm...) Overall, a beautiful hotel, and very friendly staff, but our stay left some room for improvement, though I think we were mostly just unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: flickertail
Reviews.Content: The Alexis is a beautiful hotel. I liked our large, stylish room and the great art everywhere I looked. But there were some problems. Unlike some reviewers, we did not get free internet. That was a first for us on a 10-day trip up the coast, staying at several fine hotels. I looked for the concierge on half a dozen trips through the lobby but never saw anyone at the desk. On the second night of two, the person in the room above ours paced for hours, and we heard every footfall. Garbage trucks outside were the crowning touch. There was a small balcony outside our room. When I stepped out, I saw just one chair. Were we supposed to take turns out there? And all three potted shrubs were decidedly dead. The desk clerk removed internet charges because of our sleepless night. We appreciated the gesture but didn't think we should be paying those charges to begin with. We are regular visitors to Seatle but will not stay at the Alexis again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Seattle trip!”
Reviews.Author: Akelleral
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis hotel last week and had a really nice experience. The lobby was really nice, with these cozy gray bean bag type chairs that I sort of want in my home now. The staff was so friendly, from the valet to the front desk. The lady at reception mentioned that we had a good room...she wasn't kidding. They upgraded us to a top floor suite, with a long hallway, private bedroom, living room, and dining room! It was pretty amazing, especially since we would be staying there for 5 days. It felt like our very own apartment. The only weird part was that they had a baby crib in the bedroom, but luckily the closet was huge and we could get that thing out of the way. The cost of the valet is high, but it did allow in and out privileges, which really came in handy. The bookstore bar downstairs was a great place to have a drink. They have an amazing scotch collection, but make sure you see the pricing. We were a little shocked when we got a bill for $50 for two drinks. Alexis is really in one of the most central locations. It was a 5 minute walk to Pikes Market and really close to the ferry, the highway, and anywhere else you might need to go. I would definitely stay at the Alexis again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Brian92651
Reviews.Content: A hotel where pet friendly meant a big dog barking a few rooms down. It was just ridiculous. Then to add insult to injury there were several late night party groups return to their rooms that were very noisy - being pet friendly and in such a good location is not good for those seeking quiet in a hotel. The staff is pleasant but I would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Latbrat
Reviews.Content: Mt friend and I planned a weekend trip from Vancouver, BC to Seattle. We needed a pet-friendly hotel ans we were travelling with a German Shepherd and a Chihuahua. We reserved a king deluxe room. We arrived just after 6 mp on Sat, and discovered we could park right in front of the hotel at a meter for free until Monday morning. This saved us the $36 we would have paid for valet parking! The staff were very congenial and welcomed us nicely. There was a big dog bed for the dogs, as well as a bowl with doggie biscuits. It was my friends birthday, and there was a nice Birthday greeting letter for him, as well as some tasty truffles. The room was spacious and nicely appointed, and there were some funky leopard print robes for us to use.. The location was spectacular, and we had a nice walking tour of downtown! At night we went to an Irish pub for drinks, and then a dance club just down the street. Upon our return, we found that the dogs had been noisy in the room, and since the staff could not contact us, they had brought the dogs down to 'babysit' them at the front desk! The dogs were having fun with the staff and eating doggie biscuits! Our only complaint is that there was no coffee maker in the room, and no ice machines in the hallway. You had to order ice from room service and go downstairs for coffee until 09:00 am. We had such a nice time, and cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A Seattle Favourite”
Reviews.Author: Rainuck
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Alexis and we've enjoyed both stays very much. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The staff friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again. A few notes...be sure to sign up for Kimptons Rewards program, they have nice hotels in a number of city's if you travel a lot but more importantly the membership gives you free internet access during your stay. We didn't try the onsite restaurant either visit. The only downside as seems to be the case at all downtown Seattle hotels is the price of parking...being in Vancouver we often drive down and parking easily adds $30-$40 per night to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCoops
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Alexis Hotel in 2002 and had enjoyed the experience but weren't sure how we would find it 8 years later with 2 small children. We had a fantastic time. The hotel staff were more than accommodating to all our requests and made us all feel very comfortable and relaxed. We loved our room which was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The hotel location was great - easy walk to everywhere we wanted to go. We will definitely be back and would highly recommend to any visitors to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...”
Reviews.Author: henry8wife
Reviews.Content: The Alexis Hotel is in a great location. Just blocks from the Pier and a 10 minute walk to the Pike Market. Extremely safe area. The Hotel itself is very nice. The first room we were given on the the third floor was extremely noisy due to the outside noises which made it hard to sleep peacefully. However, we asked the next morning if we could have something quieter and they accommodated us perfectly. No problems. The staff was very pleasant and professional. We have no complaints and would recommend staying here. The parking is extremely expensive- $36 a night, however everywhere in Seattle is.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Hospitable home away from home”
Reviews.Author: iluvmyshihtzu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at Kimpton Hotels whenever we visit Seattle from our not too far away home of Lacey WA. We have and eight month old baby girl and were looking for a weekend away the two of us. As a valued Kimpton InTouch member, I originally made our reservation for one of their regular king size rooms (extremely nice for a basic room in itself) but decided to email the hotel to see if there might be an upgrade available that we could get. Well, the hotel responded by giving us a fabulous suite that had it's own bedroom with master bath/spa and it's own living room a 1000 sq ft home away from home! The best part of our stay was coming back to the room after dinner and the manager, Jenne, had printed a picture of our little baby girl from my Facebook page and had it in a frame by the bed as part of the turn-down service; this brought me to tears. What a thoughtful touch! We always enjoy our stay at any of the Kimpton Hotels but like the Alexis particularily for it's location (central to get to Pike Place Market in one direction and Pioneer Square in the other). We also enjoy the Bookstore Bar there in the hotel for a nice relaxing cocktail. The wine reception from 5-6pm is an added touch that we always enjoy at Kimpton Hotels. Russell, the concierge and host of the wine reception during our stay was really knowledgable on his wines and of where to go in Seattle for food and entertainment. We ended our fabulous weekend with breakfast at the Library Bistro there on the Alexis property. Ron, our server, was excellent as was the Brioche French Toast that I had (super yummy and my mouth is watering now!!!) and my husband said his breakfast was the best ever! This hotel and the other Kimpton hotels are pet friendly and warmly accept your dogs at no charge. We let our shih tzu Snickers stay with Grammy and our baby girl this time :) Thank you to the Alexis Hotel staff for our wonderful weekend away. We look forward to more of your hospitality in the future! I would (and have in another review) recommend Alexis Hotel for your stay in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: csk1000
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very comfortable, but nothing compares to the great staff - from the front desk, to room service to the great bar staff. I only stay here when I visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to experience downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kitha
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 4 days. I was reluctant to stay in a boutique style hotel with 3 teenage boys!! but here is what worked. It is close to the Pike street market (we ate there every day), Original Starbucks, Seattle Art Museum and we walked to the Pier and to Pioneer Square. I grew up in Seattle and wanted my family to experience what Seattle was like. I didn't want the distractions of a pool and video games in the hotel...because they would of wanted to hang out there. We spent four days walking around and exploring the city! The Hotel has an historical feel and the only complaint I had was there were no ice machines, you had to ask for ice to be brought to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: netmonster
Reviews.Content: We do priceline all the time and usually stay in a starwood property and was surprised to be placed at the Alexis. The room is huge and very nice and personal, I hear they are all diferent. Very romantic and detailed. Parking is exspensive, as in all of downtown and the only negative is the distance to the downtown shopping area is about 15 min walking, The usual Seattle bums are around so that is why I'm not in love the location. The beds are great, much better than the Westin we just switched from. Many resturants are close, McCormicks 1/2 a block away was very good for dinner. This is a beautiful, old, artsy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: sunwaterlover
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and have stayed in so many hotels, but Alexis Hotel was by far the best! We stayed in President Suite and it was just gorgeous! Extremely spacious with lovely furniture and super comfy bedding! They also prepared us a nice playpen so that our 8months old son could sleep safe. The location was excellent as well. I had made some special arrangement for my spouse birthday and it went really well. It sure was a memorable stay and we WILL come back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jafware
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Alexis as a little getaway weekend. Our stay couldn't have been better. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The bar staff, especially so. Excellent selection of top shelf, small batch whiskey and scotch. The location is excellent too!

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Stay at the Alexis Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ken-in-Seattle
Reviews.Content: Spent Valentine's at the Alexis Hotel with my wife. It was a very magical stay. They rolled out the red carpet for Valentine's with a special dinner menu, and breakfast menu the following morning. They had champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, flowers, and a personalized note from me to my beautiful wife in the room before we arrived. Everything about the Alexis Hotel was great. I am planning on returning for another get-away with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “The Alexis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaB11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel a few years ago. The room was clean and a good size. The staff were very friendly and glad to help.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, would stay there again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: sjs033
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our two night stay at the Hotel Alexis. From the front desk staff, to Russell, serving wine at the evening cocktail hour. Russell was also a great source of information for dining recommendations, things to do, etc. It was also nice that the hotel was pet friendly. they had a welcome board for the dogs staying there and would write the pets name on the board. Even the dogs would hang out during the cocktail hour. I saw the hotel staff even offer to take the dog out for a quick break outside. Can it get any better than that? I just wish I had brought my dog with me! The hotel was very clean, quiet, easy access to the pier, ferry, westlake shopping center. While we didn't eat in the hotel, there were several dining options within walking distance. We were even offered an upgrade at the time of check. It was for a nominal fee, and well worth the price. Its so nice to see a hotel do this, vs. letting their high end rooms go unused. I would definitely recommend the Alexis hotel to anyone staying and working downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but not sure if it's 4 star worthy”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMum
Reviews.Content: The service here is outstanding. Every single person was friendly, outgoing, helpful and upbeat. I commend everyone for that. If you like staying in a hotel downtown right in the thick of the things, then this hotel is for you. But you may lose a bit of sleep, as it can get sort of loud, especially on a week-end. I stayed in a room on the alley and not the hotel's fault, but there was a super loud buzzing all night. It's also near a fire station, ferry terminal and freeway. If you like fresh air, then don't stay here, because if you open the windows, it's just pretty loud. I can't imagine how loud it would be on the front of the hotel. But on the other hand, it's agreat location. 10 minute walk to Pike Place Market, 15 mins to downtown and about 10 mins to Pioneer Square, 5 mins to the water The hotel itself is very boutique - eclectic art, shee shee doggies prancing around. I think the art makes it 4 star and the service. My room had 3 different colors of paint, asian paintings, lamps all very stylish. It's a nice room, a bit small, but nice. My room had a bed, sofa, desk and an armchair all in the small room. Bathroom had a Vichy shower head. Nice amenities in the bathtub, Towels a bit small. The robe, not a big deal, was not at all soft like in great hotels. It was leopard skin print to be boutiquish I'm sure, but had no upscaleness to it like in fancy hotels. You wouldn't want to wear it long at all. The quality was not very good. I booked an appointment in the steam room and waited at the door, having not been told you need to call for someone to open it. No biggie, but it would have been nice, when booking it, if I was told how the process worked. Then I get in and have to figure out to turn on the steam. No instructions anywhere, and nothing was told to me when I booked it. The steam room itself was fine. The outer room had dirty glasses and towels as if had not been checked all day and my appt was late in the evening. I would suggest that housekeeping check the room every hour or 2 and tidy it up. One thing like that leaves a bad impression. Exercise room is tiny. I didn't go in, but was surprised hwo small it was. The evening wine tasting was a nice touch. The man working there knew a lot about each wine and offered to give me a glass to take to my room. Library Bistro Bar was very cozy and nice. And the restaurant also very nice. We didn't try either, but both nicely decorated, with tons of books as well. Overall nice hotel, I would recommend it. But don't have super high 4 star expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Seattle hotel - dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: kellytherascal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis Hotel February 2010 for a weekend trip. We traveled with our golden retriever so I found this hotel searching for dog friendly hotels in Seattle. The room we booked was a 1 bedroom Alexis suite which was very roomy. There was a large living room area with a couch, two chairs and the bar area with a large plasma TV. Off that was a 1/2 bath. Back through the hall was a large master bedroom with a desk, a king sized bed, large windows and a big bathroom with a separate shower and jetted tub for two. The tub was huge and so relaxing. The service was great, it was very clean and the decor was nice. Upon arrival in to the room they also provided us with a dog bed and bowl to use during the stay for our dog which was great. I also liked that any type of room was dog friendly - they do have specific rooms in every category for those allergic to pets to stay in but for every category of room there are dog friendly rooms - a lot of hotels won't let dogs in the nicer spa suite rooms so that was great. There are no charges to bring your dog. Everyone was very friendly, quick to help out how they could and room service was excellent. Any time we called up for ice or any other service it arrived promptly. Location is super close to Pikes Market as well as lots of restaurants. The parking is very expensive for valet - 37 dollars a day but I guess that is to be expected staying in a large city. They also charge $1.50 for every local call you make so use your cell phone :) I have with the hotel in regards to traveling with a pet was the distance to an area to walk your dog - the closest grassy area was many blocks away, and at night if you are alone it can be a bit unsafe walking through downtown Seattle to get your dog out before you head to bed. If you don't mind walking though everything else about the hotel is great - but do take that in to consideration when traveling with pets.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stop in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Kitka2001
Reviews.Content: We paid a great rate for a double room and were pleasantly surprised that upon checking in we were upgraded to a suite. It was an amazing treat for the kids and a beautiful and clean room. Loved breakfast in the restaurant, and felt a great welcoming vibe in the bar. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value 4 star property in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: biztraveller25
Reviews.Content: I was originally going to book at the Hyatt Olive 8 hotel but found a 4 star mystery property on hotwire for $88/night. I booked right away and was happy to discover the Alexis Hotel. It's a newly renovated 4 story hotel located in downtown Seattle. It's close to Pike Place and the shopping core. The rooms are very trendy with plush pillows and mattress. The room we had was shower only and had a queen bed (if this is a problem for you, confirm before you check in). I didn't use the steamroom but I believe that is complimentary. Also free wifi and a managers cocktail hour between 5 and 6 with wine and hot toddys in the library bar. I believe it's dog friendly but couldn't hear or see any evidence of dogs in the halls or my room. Overall, this hotel feels posh and is nicely decorated. My room was facing 1st and I could hear the traffic slightly when I woke up in the morning. This hotel does have valet parking but I parked on the street and saved money. Seattle has free street parking after 6pm on Saturday and free on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Sheek Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiT0wnTravelers
Reviews.Content: Very trendy hotel and room. The rooms very clean, roomy, sheek and yet cozy at the same time. Excellent location in downtown Seattle to the restaurants, Pike Place and the pier. A few minute walk to anything you need. Would highly recommend this hotel as it's a great value for such a trendy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “An Old Building with Musty Smell Upon Entering a Hotel Room.”
Reviews.Author: DJNYC212
Reviews.Content: The building seems to be old, because upon entering to my room, it smells of musty mildew so i had to spray a lot of Lysol to cover it up. Also there is a steam room on 3rd floor, but you have to make appointment. I didn't know about this, so I went to steam room without appointment and without the key, I couldn't enter . There was a housekeeper near by, so I told her to open the key for me since that facility closed at 9pm and finally able to enter the sauna room and turned the on/off switch only to find out it's not working. I got this hotel room thru Priceline $99 (Tax inc) but won't stay here paying retail price. Also I called housekeeper to bring me more towels, but it took 50 mins and I had to call twice.

Reviews.Title: “Caught on tape !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: caughtavon
Reviews.Content: I checked in this dump with my 17 year on dec. 26th , 2009 only to get humiliated by the front desk clerk!!! I had forgot my credit cards, AAA card, and had only cash on me !! which was ok i thought because in had enough and my bank was a local bank!! When i checked in the clerk demanded a credit card for 100.00 a night for Incidentals, i explained about i forgot and offered to pay cash, she refused to take cash credit only. So i called my husband , she said he had to make a copy of his card and dr license, and write he authorized me to use it , I did have my license. so with the time difference, he could not do anything until next day. i went up to my room the tv was to the side of the bed, the shower looked like a lockerroom , robes were very worn out looking, room was very tiny, she sends an employee to come an get the honor bar , which was only worth about 30.00 . i went down to talk to her and she was very rude, and said its because u did not use a credit card, i said i have stayed at alot of 4 an 5 star hotels and never been humiliated like this before, she said well go stay there then!!! So i checked out and went to the Radisson, which had more amenites and better all around!!! It was all caught on tape because my friend was video tapen me cause she had not saw me in 17 years and caught this on tape !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just enjoyed a weekend stay at the Alexis Hotel in downtown Seattle, Washington. Part of the Kimpton chain of boutique hotels, the Alexis Hotel is located at the corner of First Avenue and Madison Street, across the street from Hotel 1000 and the “Taboo Video for Adults” store, and a block and a half south of the infamous “The Lusty Lady” adult theatre. Nevertheless, the Alexis Hotel is ideally located for walking to the major downtown sites – including: Pike Place Market, the Seattle Aquarium, Pioneer Square, Safeco Field for baseball and Qwest Field for football. Ferries dock just a couple blocks away from the hotel, and it is a short 5 minute taxi ride to the cruise ship terminals. Unlike many of the other downtown Seattle hotels, the Alexis Hotel has character. Front desk staff told us that the building was originally built in 1901 and most recently renovated two years ago, in October of 2007. The Alexis Hotel is a dog friendly hotel, so we saw several canines during our stay. The Alexis Hotel staff were all pleasant and helpful. Because the City of Seattle had shut off the water main to the hotel for 4 hours the day of our arrival on January 1, 2010 -- resulting in some yellowing of the water and sediment when my wife filled the large soaker tub on our first night -- the hotel did not charge us for parking our car with the hotel valet – a saving of $36 US (plus tax) per day. We stayed in room 347, a 900 square foot one bedroom suite priced at $244 US (plus tax) per night. Room 347 was spacious, clean, and typical Kimpton funky. The set up of room 347 was a little strange, but given that the building was built in 1901, the renovation was no doubt limited by the physical confines of the building structure. Room 347 has a very large master bedroom, including a lovely red brick feature wall. The stainless steel four post king size bed looked almost lonely, given the size of the bedroom. My wife found the mattress to be too firm for her, but I had two very restful sleeps and I found the mattress firmness to be just right. The 32 inch flat screen tv (no high definition channels offered) was so far away from the bed that it was actually too small for the bedroom.
