The decor in our room was very inviting and top notch, as far as I am concerned. Now, on to the bed. Wow. It was so comfortable that we didn't want to leave in the morning. I remember saying, "What time do we have to check out?". We didn't want to get up. So, I can definitely recommend The Alexis Hotel to anyone with confidence. The only cons to this hotel: Valet is a little pricey at around $30+ a night, the lobby air is a tad stale, and our shower water went a little hot here and there. Other than that, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: devonbrooke
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have stayed at a Kimpton Hotel, and it definitely won't be the last. We have stayed in at least 10 different hotels in Seattle over the years, and this was our best experience ever! First of all, the staff was excellent, starting with the very pleasant young lady who took our booking, and continuing throughout our stay. I had made a request asking for as large a room as possible at our price point, as we were 3 adults sharing a room, and that request was granted. In fact, we joked that our room was roomier than what we were used to in our homes. I had also mentioned that we were in Seattle to celebrate my friend's "milestone" birthday, and were very pleased to find a complmentary bottle of wine, and chocolates (!), with a nice note from the hotel in our room. We attended the courtesy wine get-together, and it was a very pleasant and friendly event. In fact, just prior to the event, we had run into a friend who was staying at another hotel, and when I asked at the front desk if he could join us, the answer was "of course!". I understand that the hotel has just undergone an extensive renovation - it was lovely, and both the lobby and our room were very nicely appointed. There is a lot of impressive art displayed everywhere. The Alexis feels very upscale, but warm at the same time - we felt very welcomed there. We were very impressed! We only stayed one night, but we wished it could have been for longer. We can hardly wait to go back. Kudo's to everyone at the Alexis Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alexis”
Reviews.Author: nhsuzanne
Reviews.Content: The rooms are gorgeous and so spacious. The recent renovations are very evident, and the hotel looks fresh and clean. Contrary to other reviewers, I found all of the staff to be very pleasant. My husband and I snagged a deal on Hotwire, though I would happily have paid double to stay at this hotel. The bed was heavenly, the complimentary morning coffee and evening wine were a nice touch, as was the complimentary use of yoga equipment for the room. The hotel is only four stories tall, so the road noise was a bit problematic, but easily resolved with earplugs for sleeping. I had no problems with the (complimentary) internet use. The fitness center was a little small but the equipment was new, and the room was always empty. Each piece of cardio equipment even had individual TV screens. This hotel is incredible and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Alexis Hotel Heaven on First Avenue in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: juliebug52
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the other 2 Kimpton Hotels in Seattle and the Alexis will be my first choice from now on. What we loved: Free internet. Coffee service in the room. The location. The pleasant helpful staff. The complimentary wine and beer social in the Library Bistro Bar. Ipod docking station in the room. Flat screen tv. The art in the hotel. So classy. The decorator's intention was to show what an artist's home would look like. Our room had seven lamps and none of them matched. None of the end tables or desk or tables matched but they all "worked together". We were upgraded to a spa suite. They bathroom was gorgeous with black marble floors, marble counter tops and the deepest jacuzzi tub I have seen! There was a large mirror over the tub, a nice bench in the tiled bathroom and even a bronze sculpture in the huge bathroom. My husband's only complaint was that it was a long walk to the bathroom. We slept very well here. Stay here...you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent downtown hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend at the Alexis and our experience was somewhat mixed. Physically this is a first-rate hotel: the furnishings and finish everywhere are of uniformly high quality, getting close to very expensive European hotels. We had a king room with very nice bed, sofa,chair & armoire. The hotel is only 4 stories (of rooms) high but there is essentially no street noise. The location is excellent for walking around downtown Seattle. We had a few complaints, however: the ventilation system was noisy; we just turned it off when we went to bed each night. In March this was fine (and most natives live comfortably without air conditioning). The wireless internet connection is gratis, but it came and went inexplicably; if this is important to you, you might want to pack an ethernet cable. Little things - a floor lamp that flickered, the guest info book missing pages - were overlooked. And the front desk staff was not as personable or responsive as one would expect in such a place. In contrast, the doormen were friendly and eager to please. There are several outstanding places to eat breakfast, lunch or dinner a pleasant walk away: our favorites include Tulio's by the library; Wild Ginger; Etta's at the Pike Place Market; Macrina and Flying Fish just a bit on past the Market. We didn't try the house restaurant this time around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder wonder wonder”
Reviews.Author: Alf_Ganistan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here quite a while ago. I have to say it was one of the best nights ive had out. We came down from North Van just for an overnight. After a lovely pint of ale along the waterfront watching the sun go down, we went back to the hotel for the wine tasting in the John Lennon room. The conceige said we were the first to actually finish the wine. We had an excellent time with Americans and Canadians which went onto the evening with a meal with our newly made friends in the restaurant. The concierge even sent us over starters for our meal. Have to say i thoroughly enjoyed myself. Great hotel superb town.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sea-nyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alexis the last week in December 2007 and very much were impressed with this boutique hotel. Our room had a HUGE bathroom, with an enormouse jacuzzi tub. It was wonderful. We loved the modern decor and how clean the hotel was. The location is good - the hotel is just blocks from Pike Place Market and about six blocks from many Belltown restaurants. Lastly, the Bistro Bar is the hotel is a great spot for a beer/wine, and an appetizer. We're originally from Seattle, and now live in NYC - we've stayed at many beautiful properties around the world and would certainly stay at The Alexis again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel_08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Alexis for business for two days this week. The hotel is in a great location downtown, which made it very easy to walk around and explore. The decor is very modern. The room was clean which is something I am very particular about. Nice touch with the Aveda toiletries in the bathroom. No complaints about the service. Overall friendly staff. I definitely plan to stay there from now on when visiting Seattle. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel in the Center of Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Kimpton chain which runs hotels that are all individually unique and have some quirkiness designed into the hotel. The Room: Good size for a downtown hotel. Extremely clean with modern furnishings etc that were all in great shape. Mini-bar was stocked with some unusual snacks and there was a fridge for the cold items with a bit of extra room to chill your own bottle of wine. The bathroom was clean as well with Aveda ammenities, fluffy towels and cheetah print bathrobes. (maybe the other rooms have other exotic animal robes?) The room was also blissfully quiet, despite being on the corner of 1st & Madison. The room windows opened side for fresh air. Could be a hazard if you are staying in a room with little kids who would easily fit through the opening. The service: Wine reception from 5-6 pm in the lobby was nice. The valet/bellmen were super friendly and helpful. The ladies at the front desk were not as friendly as I would have expected -almost to the point of indiffernce. They might be better suited to occupations that don't include working with people. The Location: This place is about 1/2 way between pioneer square and pike place market. It's close to the waterfront and the Seattle Art Museum and Beniroya Hall. I can't think of a more convienent location for an out of towner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceerbl
Reviews.Content: I was looking for somewhere special to stay for a couple of nights in Seattle and picked The Alexis. I had read the reviews about building work and contacted the hotel about it. They confirmed that the work would be finished before I arrived so I booked a room. I booked a spa suite and it was great with a huge bath in a massive bathroom. The room had a comfortable bed and a nice amount of space. We arrived late in the evening and we asked concierge for a suggestion for getting a pizza or similar and they suggested we order a takeout and get it delivered to the room which we did. Nice of the hotel to allow food in to the room when the restaurant was closed. Brunch was tasty in the Library Bistro, the Breakfast menu was less inspiring. The hotel is a lot of fun, drawing on the table, painting postcards in the evening at the wine reception. The staff were all lovely and I enjoyed the stay very much. For the price of the suite perhaps some breakfast could be included or maybe a small selection of drinks in the room, even just bottles of water rather than high priced mini bar produce but these are minor grumbles I have with most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a great spot!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLib
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge and stay downtown for an evening and we were looking for something special. And we found it. Lovely staff at the front desk made us feel very welcome. The room was wonderfully upscale, but funky, in a good way. Comfortable bed and fantastic shower. I love it when there's unexpected turndown service, too. No view, but a neat little terrace that looked out on Post St. Windows were triple glazed and kept the street noise to a minimum. When we checked out the next morning we were treated as if we were old friends. We'll definitely try to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nobody cared.”
Reviews.Author: travelsavyVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexis on a recent trip to Seattle to see some friends. I booked the room on hotwire and was looking forward to the experience. I understand that they have recently completed a 10 million dollar renovation, which is very obvious. The hotel is stunning; contemporary mixed with traditional. The room was fabulous, fantastic décor, great bed and an amazing shower. It was a nice size and very well appointed with marble bathroom and unique artwork. The location is also very convenient; close the market, restaurants and great shopping. All this being said, I feel that perhaps the hotel should invest some of its money training its staff on customer service. Quite frankly, I found the service to be disappointing. No one was rude or unkind; they just seemed completely indifferent. When I arrived, I walked through the front door towards the front desk. Two bellman were walking in the other direction, one said hello without smiling or really looking as though he wanted to say hello. When I arrived at the front desk, no one was there. I waited for a bout 2 minutes when one of the bellmen came by and said, “I’ll get her”. I can understand that there is work to be done behind the front desk, but no bell or any way to call someone out if needed. A girl then came out to the front desk and starting typing on a computer, she did not acknowledge me at all until she asked for my credit card. I asked how she was to which she replied “good”. I was not greeted whatsoever. In the end I was handed keys without being directed to an elevator or particular floor. Through the whole check-in process, eye contact was made twice briefly. When I got to my room I called for some ice as my friends were joining me for cocktails before we went out for dinner. No one was available in room service so the call rang to the front desk. The person on the phone had no personality in her voice whatsoever and ended the conversation with “alright then”. My departure was much the same. I was this time greeted but without a smile and hardly an eye contact. When I stated my room number, she said my last name, like it was a number. Had she put “Mr.” in front of it, she would have been addressing me personally. I then stored my bag with the bell desk. Again no greet, just took the bag and was given a ticket. I asked if there was an umbrella I could use and was told, yep, over there and he pointed to one leaning by the door. Some may say that these are picky details. The truth is that I did enjoy my stay; but when it comes to giving an objective review, I feel that all the facts should be stated. This hotel has the potential to be amazing. I did get a good deal on the room but had a paid the full price advertised at $280.00 I would have been a little more upset. I understand that the hotel had a young, hip atmosphere but when it comes to a boutique hotel, I would expect warmer, more personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hHotel with a fun atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Rettwogo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awsome, the guestrooms were just renovated and they will blow your mind. The staff is awsome and you really can't beat the location. Next time you visit Seattle you have to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its beautiful”
Reviews.Author: selectguy
Reviews.Content: I was at the Alexis a year ago and it was a little tired. Stayed last night and all I can is wow. they have redone the rooms and lobby and you feel really special. my room was huge and absolutely beautiful. nice staff and a great breakfast, (best bacon i ever had) I havent stayed in this elegant a room or hotel in a long time and I am a serious road warrior and stay at 4 star + hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gb2283
Reviews.Content: What a fun boutique hotel! They were renovating but it didn't matter, this place is still fantastic. The Bookstore bar is great as well! My only concern was the lack of counter space in the bathroom- as in there was none - at all. However when you have sleek appliances you forego convience.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok really”
Reviews.Author: Alex69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights from Aug. 27th. We were a little disapointed that construction work was still underway however at least the rooms had been finished. It appeared to be just the public spaces that were undergoing construction. The staff were friendly enough and we had no problems with room service. We did however find the hotel room a little small and I was surprised to find that almost every item in the mini-bar was actually out of date. This to me smacked of a lack of attention to detail and I I felt that the hotel did not deserve it's "boutique" like status. We would love to visit Seattle again however would not choose to stay at the Alexis, a little over-rated for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Time Save Your Money”
Reviews.Author: KayteeQ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times at Kimpton Hotels and cannot believe that the Alexis is a Kimpton. Prior to making my reservation, I inquired as to whether there would be construction at the hotel and was told there was none. WRONG! The entire place was encased in plastic. Construction debris all around. In fact, a worker dropped a tool on my leg, and no one seemed concerned over the fact that I was bleeding! We stayed in the Honeymoon Suite and were shocked to find workers looking in our skylight over our tub banging away at 7 am! Room service was a joke. Took almost 2 hrs. to get a simple order of mac and cheese and a salad. When it arrived, it was the wrong order. Had to wait almost 30 more minutes. Then, there were no utensils with which to eat. I could go on and on. TV didn't work. We were constrantly disrupted by housekeeping who would enter without knocking, never any toilet paper. etc. etc. Save your time..save your money. This place needs to get its act together!

Reviews.Title: “Plastic sheets everywhere! major remodel in full force”
Reviews.Author: coug66
Reviews.Content: This is the downside to Hotwire. I paid $216 per night for customers to stay for 2 consecutive nights. It was a get away for he and his wife and a professional outing. I dropped them off at the hotel and could scarcely believe my eyes' The first floor and lobby was a plastic tunnel. Everything was lined in clear plastic lined scaffolding. You walked through tunnels of plastic. It is not a 4 star hotel like this. It has a great location and the rooms are nice but I have never been so embarrassed to set up a customer this way. I would not stay here for anything over $100 per night in this condition. I will never book with Hotwire again for my customers. I will continue to take the risk for my own travel, mainly for the hotels locations. Do not book this hotel at a premium ( $216 less than $360) unless they have completed the remodel. It will not positively impress, wife, partner, or customer in its current state

Reviews.Title: “Queen Queen Deluxe?”
Reviews.Author: memaiani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexis for 4 nights for a "girls' getaway. The 'we' consisted of 3-52 yr. old women who have been friends since college. We have travelled together before and I do my best to find accommodations that are roomy with places to sit and relax besides the beds. We didn't book the room until May so our choices were limited, i.e. a King suite which had a sitting area and a pull out couch, would've caused the dilemma of who would sleep on the pull out? We decided on a 'Queen Queen Deluxe' because it was said to have almost 500 sq. ft. and we thought there'd be plenty of room. I initially booked it on the hotel's website for $346/night and later found what I thought were the same accommodations on hotels.com for $296/night. We stayed in room 309 and 'spacious' isn't a term I'd use to describe it. In fact, if we would've kept the desk chair at the desk, it would've obstructed the pathway from the sleeping area to the bathroom. Besides the desk chair, there was one other chair with an ottoman. However, we needed to move the ottoman into the bathroom because there wasn't any counter space to put anything on. There was just a square, pedestal sink above a cabinet and although it was lovely, it was highly impractical--especially for 3 women needing to use curling irons and put on makeup using the handy make up mirror provided. Even a single businessman would be at a loss as to where he should put his razor and toothbrush. The coffee pot was kept in the cabinet below the sink but where were you suppose to plug it in? You couldn't have set it on the floor because the plug wouldn't have reached the outlet. If you put it on the desk, you had to unplug something else and you also needed to pull the desk out to fit the plug behind it. Since I wasn't even sure the plug was long enough to reach the outlet, I didn't even attempt that. There wasn't a phone book in the room so when we called the front desk, we were told there usually is but they would send one up. When they did so, I suspect the gentleman who delivered it was looking for a tip but I'm not tipping for something that should've been in the room. Also, if 3 adults were booked into the room, why was it only set up for 2? What saved the stay was the friendliness of the entire staff and the fabulous location. We ate at the Bistro Bar and the food along with the presentation was excellent. Beware if you're thirsty tho, because you will wait a long time for drinks even if the bar isn't busy which was the case when we were there. Being 3 former bartenders, we agreed we never let anyone sit at our bar with an empty glass but this wasn't the case with the bartender we had. We had to ask for every drink and even if she wasn't serving a waitress or anyone else, she still proceded to do something, ANYTHING, before making our drinks. However, we did seem to find that to be the norm anywhere we went in Seattle. The time between order and delivery was always much longer than we felt was realistic. If the Alexis could provide us with more comfortable accommodations, we would most likely stay there again because of its very convenient location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Under renovation - beware”
Reviews.Author: RHOBoston
Reviews.Content: We were referred to them from another Seattle hotel that was full for the night we wanted to stay. Booked directly with the hotel, and decided to take a small suite for my wife, self and 16 year old son. $499 plus taxes for the night. High, but it was a celebration night - start of our vacation trip. What they did not tell us was that they were under renovation, and our room was right in the middle of it. On the plus side of it, the checkin was great, the person at the desk friendly and helpful, and they even sent up a small bottle of champaign after they heard that it was my birthday. Very thoughful of them, and we had a great dinner at Place Pigalle, which he also recommended. Oops - but the fitness room was closed. - Do you have an alternate? oh yes, they finally volunteered, at a nearby gym, but they didn't give us tickets until we asked again. The wallpaper in one of the front hallways was stained, as were some of the carpets, leading to a general feeling that the property was just not up to snuff. He didn't let us know about the renovation, which was apparent as soon as we set foot on the elevator - it was sheathed in ratty plywood with a not-so-cute label pasted on it that said "Creating a new artwork for you" or something similar. The room was stark, with no artwork on the walls, although it was clean. Bathroom was ok. Nice TV's. No turndown service. 2 bathrobes. Nice touch, but there were three of us. We had to get our own pillows and blanket out of the closet and set up the bed oursleves for my son,, who was sleeping on the pull out couch. The next morning Sunday) at 7:30 the people started moving furniture into the hallway in front of our door, and the entire place was a construction zone by 8am. Nobody at the front desk even told us that this was going to go on. I went down and had my complimentary breakfast alone, served by a surly waiter. When my wife and son went down for breakfast, they were told it was not complimentary, and so they passed on any breakfast or coffee. When we checked out, the bill was full rate, and my breakfast was billed on it as well. We complained then and there, and they appologised, and asked us if we would like a comp room for another night, but we were only in Seattle for one night, and we wouldn't stay there again anyway. So they dropped the breakfast charge, and $100 of the room fee. Good effort, but not enough to make us want to stay there again. When we were checking out, the person said that "this renovation is really awful", running late, and was causing all sorts of customer problems. No kidding. In summary, for $499 (or even $400, our final room rate) this was deeply disappointing. The breakfast snafu, the construction, the lack of facilities, the dirty and stained public areas and the noisy rooms (we were on the 3rd floor) made this our least favorite hotel experience in years. The following night we had a night at the Holiday Inn Express in Salem OR for $110, and it was a MUCH better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill”
Reviews.Author: PhilipFamily
Reviews.Content: We booked the Alexis for 1 night for our anniversary. What a horrible experience. We now live near Seattle but I had stayed there a couple of times when I used to travel to Seattle on business in the early '90's. I remembered it as wonderful! I don't know what happend but...... We had let them know it was our anniversay and had asked for a bottle of champagne in the room when we arrived. Nothing. It took them 1 1/2 hours to bring it. We had tickets for a play at 7:30pm. We arrived at 5:00pm and tried to order room service along with the champagne. We were told we could not get food in time to make it to the play which was 3 blocks away. We asked if at least they could throw together a cheese plate. No. We tried to get into the bistro downstairs....no room. We ended up eating stuff from the mini bar. Got back from the play around 10:00pm. No more room service and the bistro was not serving any more. The area restaurants were packed, so we ended up eating the rest of the food from the minibar. The room was awful. It was in the new area and had absolutely no ambience nor decor to speak of. The staff was completely disinterested and when we took our issues to the management, we received no response. We even wrote to Kimpton and received no response from them. I would not recommend this place to ANYONE any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kadoogan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times on business. The location is perfect for a stay in downtown Seattle. It’s about 3 blocks from Pike’s Market, 2 blocks from the museum and a short stroll down to the waterfront. The rooms are classic Kimpton, comfortable bed with eclectic furnishings and all the amenities that you may need. The staff is very friendly, if not a bit slow (I blame that on the computer systems though). The Bookstore is a wonderful and quite place to stop in for food and a drink, the staff there are very friendly as well. The Library is their other restaurant, the service is very slow but the food is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter83
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some friends at the Alexis for three nights in early April. We had booked a spacious fireplace suite and when we checked in, we were given room 422 - the John Lennon Suite. It was an awesome room, very large, with a hallway, closet, large bathroom with jetted tub, large bed seperated from the main room with sliding doors, a dining room table, large bar area, sitting area surrounded by the fireplace and tv unit. The room was themed with John Lennon and Beatles memorabilia. A great sterio hung on the wall and the fireplace was a real treat for Seattle. Although we had mostly sunny days, one rainy chilly night made for the perfect time to stay in and light the fireplace. We ordered room service once and it was delicious! The daily wine hour is a real treat, the staff was amazing with all of our requests! I do not agree one bit with any of the comments about the staff. We had a great experience and will definitly go back and suggest The Alexis to anyone visiting Seattle. Location, location, location is all I can say about The Alexis. It is just a few blocks Pike's Place and across from the trendy Hotel 1000. A new four seasons is being built a few blocks away, but with the renovations in store for The Alexis it is a sure bet! The hotel has some work going on, but you barely notice. Our view was not amazing, but the room made up for it. The art in the hotel was another treat. The nearby Wild Ginger was one of the best meals we had the whole week as was the Bluesteel Diner - in case you are looking for some restaurant suggestions. Lastly, it is a pet friendly hotel so it was nice to see some puppies in the lobby. I do not agree with comments about the smell of the hotel, if anything it is from the perfume shop at the entrance. Overall, it's a great place to stay and I highly recommend it to anyone. We had a great rate of approx. $228 with a AAA discount and would recommend the large and spacious fireplace suite to anyone traveling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleWa365
Reviews.Content: What can I say. Booked a special night for $284, and was very disappointed. Although the lobby is very nice, it is downhill from there. Stayed in a "deluxe suite", which is like an emtpy airplane hangar. A huge room with almost no furnishings, sort of like sleeping in a warehouse. They charged $32.00 for parking for one night, but couldn't make change for $40.00. All put out because I wanted to pay cash and didn't have exact change. This place is a has been dump. Please please stay in one of the newer places like the 1000 or the W. The Alexis is a pathetic washed up joke! Wish I had paid more attention to the negative reviews. They are right on!

Reviews.Title: “Always a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Concha15
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Alexis several times on business. Impeccable attention to details, incredibly helpful staff, relaxing atmosphere, great bar downstairs, ideally situated between Pioneer Square and Pike Place Market. Most recently stayed for two nights and upon check-in was upgraded to a deluxe King room. Loved it. The room had a "receiving area" to take off your shoes and jackets; spacious sleeping and sitting areas; huge, sparkling-clean bathroom with jetted tub (and L'Occitane toiletries!); even a little balcony with French doors. I always look forward to sinking into their amazing beds, plush with down comforters and feather pillows. Heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gypsy_bunny
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle for 7 nights and I asked the Alexis Hotel to assign me a Quiet room. They assigned me Room 521, which is a little bit away from the Elevator. What they don't tell you is that the Quiet rooms face an Alley way, where a dumpster truck comes 3 times a week at 11 PM and creates a racket for about half an hour! Not very good when you are trying to get over your jet lag and resting before important business meetings the next morning. Also, the same alley way has a club of some sort and you can hear the noise from there as well. Perhaps they need to put better sound proofing on their windows. There is a building facing the hotel on the opposite side so if you choose lower floors you might find the view obstructed. Decor was dated. Also a warning for women travellers .. The hotel is on 1st Avenue which is not a good road to be walking in alone at night Overall a pretty bad experience for $276 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, modern, understated, affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: Nancyshhdoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week over New Year and were upgraded to a King room (the one in the brochures!) Huge, very comfy bed, french windows, big basket of yummy food and other goodies (with accompanying price list), as well as a mini bar and coffee machine. The bathrobes were funky animal print, and I even succumbed to the oh-so-soft socks that were for sale in the wardrobe. We wanted for nothing - whirlpool bath, hot shower, plenty of Aveda products in the bathroom that were reguarly replaced by housekeeping, and the nightly turndown, and room tidy up with chocolates made it feel extra special. It was great to have two armchairs. Almost every time we wanted a taxi, the doorman offered us the services of one of the hotel's drivers, for not much more than a taxi fare, so we travelled in soft leather seats, in style. This hotel is perfectly positioned for ease of access by foot to all of the Seattle tourist attractions. The bookbar is a lovely bar to pass the time of day, with indie/aor/soft rock/ music playing, as well as lots of magazines, books and tvs to view. A great place to watch the world go by. We had a couple of breakfasts inThe Library Bistro, and found it to be a laid back, chilled out place, where child diners could be kept entertained by drawing on the brown paper tablecloths provided. We managed to catch only one wine reception between 5-6 as we were so busy, and were given a choice of good-quality wines, to sip whilst I painted a postcard. The artwork on the walls was changed whilst we were there, as well as the selection of magazines in our room. Probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in and would definately look to Kimpton when choosing another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “expected it to be nicer”
Reviews.Author: DrfromSFO
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Seattle for business and a couple of people had recommended this hotel. I had higher expectations. When I checked in, the front desk woman seemed confused and inexperienced. I asked for any upgrades and she quoted me only one at an extra $260 per night. I laughed. I was on the second floor and I was stunned by the horrible musty smell in the hallways. My room also smelled smoky and musty. Really foul. I went and purchased some incense for my stay. I called down and requested a room change and was told nothing was available. My room had already been pre-paid as I had booked it on-line as a flight-hotel-car package. The room was noisy and cold. Sparsely decorated and furnished which was surprising since they tout themselves as an "art hotel." The curtains wouldn't stay closed; I had to use paperclips to hold them together to dark out the room. The hallways are noisy and you hear everyone coming and going. The bath was like a Holiday Inn, the only saving grace the Aveda products. I coudn't get the wireless internet system to work and had to have a cable brought up, which took about 10 minutes. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly and seemed very knowledgeable. The bed was average for what I am accustomed. I booked a massage in the spa which was pricey, but quite good. There seems to be a period of two hours in the morning between breakfast and lunch 10am to 11:30am when you cannot be served a meal!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as we thought it should be.”
Reviews.Author: youngarchitects
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Romantic Package and splurged on a room that is normally out of our price range. We were upgraded to a larger room but were disappointed with the sparse furnishings. The bathrooms are not much nicer than a Best Western. The room had a lot of noise filtering in from the hall which made us feel like we had no privacy. We worried the whole time that people could hear us. The restaurant was closed so we ordered dinner from the bar downstairs and the food was overcooked. When I let the Hotel know of our issues they responded saying that they will be renovating the rooms soon and they comped our dinner. We were really unimpressed with the Hotel and do not recommend it unless of course you do not think $350/night is a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with upgrade”
Reviews.Author: rainbow_jenny
Reviews.Content: Difficult time with check-in: when the bellman took us to our room, he realized it was occupied. The wrong room number was written on our key card! The next room he took us to was a smoke-filled and musty floor and the room just had smelled despite it being a non-smoking . I was ready to move to another hotel if they didn't have other options for us. Fortunately, the frontdesk reassigned us to the newer tower and gave us an upgrade (from executive to one-bedroom suite). We had a pleasant stay and enjoyed the spaciousness and the skylight in the living room. The location was perfect to Pike Market and the Piers. I don't believe I'll go back to the Alexis. It's more dated than the website photos suggest. Nevertheless, we appreciated the one-bedroom room suite, decent value for a bit over $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Huge Room, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to make a 4 day trip to Seattle. Last time we stayed with friends but since our son is now 2 years old we decided it would be easier for all if we stayed at a hotel and we thought it would be fun to stay downtown. Due to the child we wanted to stay in a suite but at a reasonable price. Overall we are very happy with the Kimpton Alexis. The best part was the service. I'd say this hotel has among the best service of any hotel I've ever stayed at and certianly the best for it's price. Every single member of staff was great, from the valet who took our car to the front desk people to the phone people to the room service folks. When I say "great", I mean the staff was friendly, extremely responsive, and truly seemed to care that we had a good stay. They managed to make us feel that we were the most important people in the hotel all the time. Service speed was blazing fast. When we called down for an extra cot for the boy they had it up to us in a few minutes. When we wanted them to park our car, or get it out for us, they ran to do it. When we asked the front desk for directions they were right there helping us out, giving us a choice of maps. I could go on (I won't) but bottom line is some manager at this hotel is very very good at training and motivating staff. The location of the hotel is excellent. Only a few blocks from the Pike Place market where we like to go for breakfast. One block from the Seattle art museum (alas, closed until 2007) and generally accessible to downtown. Just down the road from Pioneer square. About 8 blocks from shopping. A little further from the space needle and similar abut you can still walk it, or walk part way and take the monorail (kind of fun), or just take a cab. The main room of the suite we got was huge. It was sort of sparsely furnished though, so did not fully take advantage of the space. But nice enough. The bedroom was smaller but big enough for the bed. The bathroom was sort of a dissapointment it that it did not really match the hotel. Small and sort of cheap. But it was new and clean, and was fine. The worst part of the room was the noise from the road. We were on the second floor (room 222) of the new part of the hotel and the road noise was quite bad. Trucks, cars with stereo systems going, motorcyles, and more, seemed to be right inside the room with us. They could use much better soundproofing in our room. The sounds did die down late at night and anyway I was able to fall asleep so I'd say it was more annoying than anything. I suspect rooms on the higher floors are quieter and next time I stay at this hotel I'll ask for one. You've got to factor in the price when evaluating a hotel. This one was a very fair deal for a large suite, in a great location, and with outstanding service. If I could give it 4 1/2 stars I would. Next time we are in Seattle we'll likely give this hotel another go.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the Seattle area and we thought it would be fun to spend a night on the town and not have to drive home afterwards. We chose the Alexis because of its reputation-good enough for the Sultan of Brunei-and because of its proximity to Pike Place Market. We found our room to be large but rather empty and stark. Being somewhat cavernous, we found, as we were trying to go to sleep, that every noise from the hallway echoed loudly in the room. We heard constant noise from the elevator traffic just outside our door as well as every knock on every door . We thought that by 2 a.m. the noise from the street below and the hotel guests would subside but we were wrong. The Alexis seems to be quite the "Party Hotel" on Saturday night. Finally, at 3 a.m. we gave up all hope of getting any sleep when the man in the room next to ours got into a fight with his partner. We called the Front Desk and informed them that we were checking out and going home so that we might still get a few hours of sleep. We were appreciative that we were not charged for our stay, however, we were mostly disappointed that no one from the hotel management staff followed up with us the next day or EVER. After serveral weeks, I logged on to my "Kimpton In Touch" loyalty program and sent an email to their corporate office explaining our poor experience. Would you belive that we still haven't gotten a response! Kimpton "Cares" - what a joke. We will probably continue to boycott all Kimpton hotels for the rest of our lives!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice room and service!”
Reviews.Author: gitnby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights with wife and 2 teenaged boys. Lovely hotel in great location for exploring Seattle. Room(2 queen beds) was huge! Had to be over 1000 sq ft! No view to speak of, but room was quiet, even with construction across the street. Very nice beds, very comfy. Bathroom nothing special, but nice towels, good water pressure. Wine tasting from 5-6PM very neat deal! Service is fantastic throughout hotel. I swear you could have put 5 more beds in this room! We had a rollaway brought up, nice twin-size. I wonder why they don't add a bathroom and wall off this into a 2 bedroom suite? Pike Place Market a short walk(3-4 blocks), Pioneer Square(3 blocks), Waterfront(2 blocks). Had the best Gyros ever at a little place in Pioneer Square. Fed the 4 of us for $25 with drinks! It's on 1st street on the right as you walk from hotel. Look for sign-NY style Pizza, Gyros. It might be called Mediterranean Mix? Also ate at Il Bistro in Pike Place. Authentic Italian, very good! Not too expensive, really.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: OnEarth
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Alexis while in town to visit friends and watch the superbowl. The staff was remarkably friendly, attentive and helpful. The King Deluxe room was wonderful, the bed divine. My room faced west and while I heard some traffic it was quite soft and not an issue. I was near the elevator but never disturbed. I highly recommend this establishment and will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner & I spent a lovely evening at the Alexis, sadly we only had one evening. The room was spacious and very comfortable (#425). The bed was to die for, and the setting peaceful and on the doorstep of everything you might want to do in the area. The artwork and ambiance was relaxing and thoroughly enjoyable. The friendly welcome (we arrived very late)and the thoughtful arrangement for a late departure was most appreciated as we had a long flight to Australia the next day. The reception staff were particularly outstanding especially on the day of our departure (Jan 28th 2006) There is absolutely no doubt that whenever we visit Seattle it will be at the Alexis that we will stay. It truly is a very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: syrurs1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me by bringing me to the Alexis on our last night of a week-long vacation. We had spent 6 days in the San Juan Islands and wanted to spend our last night in Seattle before flying out. We both loved this hotel! The valet and check-in personnel were both very pleasant and helpful. For instance, after we checked in, we realized that we had left a few items in our car and wanted to retrieve them ourselves, but the valet was happy to do so and did so quickly. The room was superb, as it was both spacious and very well appointed. The ceilings and windows were very high. The bed was comfortable as were the pillows. We both loved the bathroom, which judging by the other reviews, must have been recently renovated. The bathroom was spacious and had sage green tile walls and a grey tile floor. The towels were white and fluffy. The fixtures were a shiny metal and the bathroom had a big glass shelf on which you could put your bath stuff. The featured bath products were Aveda, so I made sure to take those home! Both of us repeatedly said that we wanted our bathroom at home to look like this! We also took advantage of the complementary private sauna, which I believe is on every floor. One call to the front desk, and it was ours for a full hour. The sauna was spotless and beautiful. It looked as if no one had ever used it. The hotel was very very close to Pike Place and other attractions. Walking to those places was easy. We both wished that we could have spent more time here. If we return to Seattle we will definately stay here. We felt it was worth the ~$300 price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & stay”
Reviews.Author: Bendites
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights at the Alexis. (Sat-Tues) It was a combo business/pleasure trip for my husband and myself. This hotel has a wonderful location just a couple blocks up from the Piers and the ferry. We parked the car and did not need it. Easy walks to catch the ferry, walk to Pikes Market, restaurants and plenty of shopping. We booked a "Hot Rate" from their website. Our room was huge. No noise from neighbors of the streets. They have a small but effective fitness room and a steam room. Dogs are also welcome here and they all seemed to be having a nice stay. Food & Beverage is not a strong suit of this hotel but with so many choices in the area it was not a worry. We had a wonderful meal at Il Bistro at Pikes, Sushi a block away at Nijo. Plenty of early late Happy Hours are also in the area. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Alexis!”
Reviews.Author: Mtngrl
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Alexis Hotel over Thanksgiving weekend and had a wonderful experience. We arrived early in the morning, and to our surprise our room was ready. The room was exceptionally large! As you entered the room, there was a long entryway. It included a desk (where my husband was able to get a lot of work done as it was quiet and separate from the main part of the room) and then a long decorative entry table. As you enter the main part of the room, there were two queen beds separated by another desk, two chairs with an end table (with quite a few magazines on Seattle) between them, the armoire with the tv, video game, and mini bar inside, then breakfast table and chairs. Up a few steps was the bathroom and a dressing room. The dressing room was about 10'x10' and had a wall size framed mirror. Very nice when getting ready to go out. Since we had our two children with us, the hotel brought up a rollaway bed so the kids could sleep separately. The rollaway was not the fold in half style, but rather a real twin bed. That was put in the dressing room. There was still plenty of room for all of our luggage in there as well. The room was well appointed, and while we faced the main road, we did not have any problem with noise. We also never heard a peep of noise from other rooms. The hotel bar, The Bookstore, was cozy and very nice. They have 64 single malt scotches, and some excellent cocktails. We had a very good breakfast at the hotel restaurant, The Library. The hotel lobby has a beautiful Chihuly glass art piece in the center. In the evenings, the hotel hosts a wine reception in that area with postcard painting. There are blank postcards set out with watercolors for guests to use. It was fun to see so many adults participating and mingling. The valets were very efficient and always friendly. The hotel location was perfect for us. We were able to walk all over the city center without a problem. About a block away was an internet coffee shop and also a drug store. We needed a few extra things during this trip, and the hotel was wonderful at helping us out. It was truly a gem of a hotel and we look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Squalid And Overpriced!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 3 nights at the Alexis, on the basis of the good reviews that it had received on TripAdvisor. We ended up staying only one night because the room was so squalid. It was huge, but there was not much furniture in it, the bathroom was old, and the air conditioning system made terrible noises. To make matters even better, some drunken local was grabbing us in the bar, and the staff did nothing about it. For less money, we stayed in the beautiful W hotel. Stay away from the Alexis!!!

Reviews.Title: “In Seattle, the Alexis is hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBristol
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a six-night stay at the Alexis, and I enjoyed every moment. I got the room for a bid of $140/night on Priceline. With taxes and fees the cost came to $163/night, which I feel was reasonable for a place of this caliber. On checkout my bill showed the room rate at $139/night, which pleased me: that meant I had shaved my Priceline bid very close to the true bottom line. What I liked best about the Alexis were its great location, the quietness of the room, and the first class treatment I got from the staff. When the front desk found out I would be checking in on my birthday, they upgraded me to a view room on the top floor and sent up a bottle of champagne. That set a great tone for me. It seemed that every interaction I had with the staff from then on was positive. The staff appeared to be mostly in their 20s and 30s and they were cheerful, competent and confident. I was pleased the Alexis sits astride the intersection of four Seattle neighborhoods. Many good restaurants and attractions are a short walk away. Head down First Avenue a few blocks and you're in Pioneer Square. Go the other way and you're at Pike Place Market. Head east to Fourth and Fifth Avenues, and you're in the downtown shopping and business districts. Head two blocks west and you're in the heart of the tourist waterfront. The Alexis lacks a great in-house restaurant. I had a room service deliver a dinner and a breakfast and the food was perfectly fine but not inspired. However you can charge your meals to your room at several excellent dining establishments in the area. Close by the hotel is McCormick & Schmick's, which packs in the locals night after night with fine seafood prepared New American style. I have been fortunate enough to stay at most 4-Star hotels in downtown Seattle and now believe I have stayed at the best: The Alexis.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Debits2000
Reviews.Content: The location was great as we did not rent a car. We walked or took the bus and got everywhere we wanted to go. We were on our honeymoon and were told [when booking the room] to ask for upgrade when we checked in, we were told there were none available. We were in a King Deluxe. The Front Desk did send up a bottle of champagne, which was nice. I was surprised to read a recent review on here that someone had the Executive Suite for $200 which isn't much more than we paid, booking back in February. The room was comfortable and we faced the water. We were on the 5th floor and there were no noise issues at all. Since we were there for 5 days, we actually unpacked and found that the dresser drawers would barely open and close. I guess most people don't bother doing so. There was no in-room safe, which I like to have available. The Wine hour was nice and the delivery of French Press coffee each morning was welcome. The front desk did provide us with a vase to use for the beautiful flowers we got from Pike Market {a MUST see}. We had massages at the Aveeda Spa which were reasonably priced but the spa is small and sparce. It was an impulse, I would have looked online for other options otherwise. The lack of concierge was noticable, however the valet/bellmen were most helpful. The bathroom was large but lacking any luxury feel. However, they had THE softest towels I have ever used! All in all, a nice place. Not the luxury of an Omni or Sofitel, but nice in its own right.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Alexis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Alexis in Downtown Seattle for our vacation in late August. Contrary to some of the negative reviews posted here, we had a great stay in the heart of downtown Seattle. Our rooms were just the right size for a couple (I can see it being cramped if we had two kids). The appointments were very tasteful and proximity to downtown allowed us to put off renting a car for a couple of days. Being just 2 blocks from Pike's Market place, 2 blocks from the new Seattle Library, and within walking distance of all the restaurants and attractions along the shores of Elliot bay lets one thoroughly experience downtown Seattle. A note about Rental Cars: DO NOT rent a car if you want to spend a good deal of your time downtown - with the cabs and frequent busses, you would be wasting money and time trying to find parking. We had to rent a car to check out the San Juan islands and Snoqualmie falls. However, we were able avoid paying the hotel $26/day for valet by using off the street parking. The parking restrictions are only in effect from 8AM to 6PM. If you leave before 8AM you won't have to pay anything. If you return after 6PM (which is usually the case if you really spend some time at your destination), then there is plenty of parking right next to the Hotel (we got parking immediately in front of the door both nights) - and you don't pay anything. Its only $1.50/hr (2 hour limit) if you had to keep the car in the parking spot during the day. All in all, we spend $3 for parking the car for 2 days instead of the $52 + valet tips if we went with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: I probably never would have thought of trying the Alexis, as we usually stay at chains like the Four Seasons or the Ritz-Carlton, but I had been to this property previously for a meeting and was very impressed. I've returned twice since then, and have been extremely pleased with each visit. We stayed in a newly-renovated Executive Suite on both occasions, and the room was quite spacious (about 900 sq ft) with a skylight, noise-proofed windows, and new furnishings. The restaurant and room service were both superb, and quite reasonably priced, and the staff was extremely helpful. The bathroom was not up to the luxury of the rest of the suite, but it was fine... The evening reception was very nice, and the kids (and adults) loved the watercolor postcards! Of note, the property welcomes dogs, and even greets them with their own welcome sign in the lobby! We paid $200 for the suite, a remarkable deal compared to the prices other properties were asking in June!

Reviews.Title: “We Just Loved the Alexis!!!”
Reviews.Author: jakester20
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights prior to getting on an Alaska cruise and choose the Alexis for its tremendous location, uniqueness, and overall charm. We were not let down one bit during the three nights we stayed there. Upon arrival, we were immediately upgraded to room 419; the John Lennon Suite. It was great. The entire hotel has wireless free wireless internet, a tremendous amenity. The fitness center is just down the hall; super. The staff could not be nicer and more pleasant. Also, the concerns we had about noise from reading the reviews never surfaced and we all slept like babies for the three nights we were there. What truly makes the Alexis special is its location. Go out the hotel and turn left and a few blocks away is Pikes Place Market. Turn right and another few blocks is Pioneer Square. Go down the hill and another few blocks is the Waterfront. A short cab ride is either downtown or Seattle Center. A car would be a tremendous trouble and completely unnecessary. In total, a great hotel for either the business or weekend getaway. We highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: malibuhanson
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about the Alexis is the location. From the Alexis we could walk to most of the major attractions; Pike Place market, Pioneer Square, the waterfront (aquarium, ferry terminals), the new library, Seattle Art museum and the major shopping district. There are alot of great restaurants, coffee shops, galleries and unique boutiques all in the blocks surrounding the hotel. My son will be attending UofW in the fall and we easily caught a bus to the campus. The hotel proved to be a really pleasant surprise. Our room was very spacious with two queen beds. We had two large windows looking out on 1st ave. and even though there was construction across the street, the soundproofing is so good we didn't hear a thing. There was a skylight in the front part of the room which allowed me (an early riser) to read the morning paper while my teenage sons slept in the dark part of our room undisturbed. The room had plenty of extra pillows for the very comforable beds, fluffy robes, good coffee and Aveda products in the bathroom. The lobby was never busy. Coffee and tea service in the morning a nice treat and I especially liked the free wine tasting in the evenings. The Alexis charges for parking. I'm really glad I didn't rent a car, it's completely unnecessary in Seattle (great public transit) and parking expensive everywhere. We paid $185 a night. Reasonable for the great location, beautiful quiet room with really comfy beds, great service (ask the very knowledgeable concierge for restaurant suggestions) and free wine. I will stay here whenever I visit my son at college.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: WestSeattleSaysHi
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, friendly hotel with nice décor and a great location, however it is not exactly a luxury hotel. The concierge doesn't work Sundays or after 6 on weeknights. Our room, one up from the standard room, was smaller than what you would find at the Hilton or Westin for the same price and the furnishings weren't quite as nice. While the hotel does have an incredible glass sculpture on display in the lobby, there wasn't much more art than you would find at a similarly priced hotel. The Aveda Spa, et cetera are all accessed from the street as well as the hotel. The bathroom was nothing special - tub/shower combo are smallish. And, the windows, while beautiful, are far from sound proof. If you stay here, be sure to ask for a room facing away from 1st, unless you like the sounds of traffic and the construction project across the street. All in all, a nice hotel, but what you are really paying for is the location, not luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice location downtown. Two blocks from the Waterfront restaurants. Five blocks from Pike place. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Cost $26 a night to park your car. Valets park and pick it up for you from the parking garage. Great bed and awsome pillows. High ceilings in room. Has closet instead of wardrobe cabinet. Nice large bathroom, can actually shut and open the door with someone else in the room. Lobby is not spectacular. Free wine tasting every evening and free coffee (yum) and tea in the lobby in the morning. Got a deal on the room from Travelzoo ($140 a night). Regular price is twice that much. This is what I would expect from a Boutique hotel (a person greeted you in the morning for the wakeup call, not an answering machine). Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: randala
Reviews.Content: Very fussy ex-meeting planner ... LOVED this hotel. From check-in to check-out, they did everything right. I had read on this forum that it can be noisy, so I requested a quiet room, and got one of the best hotel rooms of my entire life. The bathroom was triple the size of mine at home. The bedding was the highest quality; Aveda amenities; spa on premises; cute little bistro too; free pint of Haagen Daz coupon upon check-in was a nice touch. The hotel really is a work of art -- it's everywhere. To a person, every single staff person I encountered seemed to want only to exceed my expectations. And they love pets and welcome them warmly with a cute sign in the lobby. Terrific, helpful concierge. Perfect location right by the waterfront -- most downtown Seattle hotels were several blocks up. Unfortunately for them, there is big construction going on directly across the street of the front of the hotel, so be sure to request a room facing the opposite direction. This hotel was a dream. I didn't want to leave. Truly one of the very best hotel experiences of my life, and I have stayed at hundreds of hotels thru my work.
